Alert: NPS Chainsaw training at Arcola Day Use Area and Osceola Glade
Description: NPS chainsaw training will be occurring at Arcola Day Use Area and Osceola Glade April 5-14. To ensure public safety, access to areas within these units will be restricted during the training.

Alert: Road Closures During the Revolutionary Run - Sunday, April 16
Description: Closures from 4:30 AM to 11 AM on 4/16. Outer Line Dr closed between the park entrance on Rt 23 and Rt 252. Inner Line Dr closed at all Rt 23 intersections. Gulph Rd closed between Rt 23 and intersection with Thomas Rd. County Line Rd closed at Rt 23.

Alert: Covered Bridge Closed Due to PennDOT Road Work
Description: The Covered Bridge, located at the intersection of Valley Creek Rd/Rt 252 and Yellow Springs Rd, is temporarily closed today due to PennDOT road work on Yellow Springs Rd. The estimated time of reopening is 2 PM on Wed. Apr. 5, 2023.

Alert: Temporary Closure of Lower Parking Lot Restroom for Renovations
Description: Beginning Monday, Jan 9, 2023, the restroom in the lower lot near the visitor center will be closed for renovations. Portable toilets will be available for public use. Anticipated reopening of the facility at the end of April 2023

Alert: County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday
Description: County Line Road is temporarily closed during the week, from Monday through Friday due to heavy construction traffic. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.

Alert: No Ferry Service on Mondays or Tuesdays
Description: The ferry service to the fort is closed on Monday & Tuesday. However, the visitor center and surrounding grounds remain open seven days a week.

Alert: Credit/Debit Card only for park entrance fees starting May 1st
Description: Starting May 1, 2023, Prince William Forest Park will enter a trial period of no longer accepting cash for park entrance fees. Entrance fees and passes can be purchased with credit/debit card or online through recreation.gov.

Alert: Prince William Forest RV Campground will be closed until July 2023
Description: Due to infrastructure improvements, the concession operated RV campground off of Hwy 234 will be closed until July 2023.

Alert: Closure of Campsites in Park Campgrounds
Description: Due to infrastructure improvements this summer, Turkey Run Group Campground will be closed 6-20-23 thru 10-27-23, Cabin Camp 3 will remain closed until 8-2-23, and campsite A1-A24 of Oak Ridge Campground will be closed 8-1-23 thru 11-16-23.

Alert: Graves Creek Road and East Fork Quinault Trail Closure
Description: Graves Creek Road, Graves Creek Campground and East Fork Quinault Trail closed to pedestrian and vehicle traffic from April 17 to May 25, 2023 during road and foot bridge repairs.

Alert: Sol Duc Campground Opening Delayed until April 7, 2023 or Later
Description: The Sol Duc Road opened on March 28th, 2023, however, the Sol Duc campground will not open until April 7th. Delays are due to heavy snow and additional maintenance that is needed.

Alert: Closure of the Hurricane Ridge Day Lodge
Description: From approximately April 2023 to May 2024, the Hurricane Ridge Day Lodge will be closed while it undergoes a major rehabilitation project, funded through the Great American Outdoors Act. Temporary facilities will serve visitors to Hurricane Ridge.

Alert: Hurricane Ridge Closed for Construction March 27 through May 25, 2023.
Description: As a major rehabilitation of the Hurricane Ridge Day Lodge begins, Hurricane Ridge and Hurricane Ridge Road will be closed to vehicle, bicycle, and foot traffic for visitors' safety. Hurricane Ridge will reopen for Memorial Day weekend.

Alert: Construction at Rialto Beach March 20 to April 10, 2023
Description: During replacement of the toilets at Rialto Beach, there will be changes to parking availability and accessibility at Rialto Beach. The Rialto Beach area will be closed to the public on March 28, 2023.

Alert: Olympic National Park Visitor Center Open During Race St. Construction
Description: A City of Port Angeles construction project is underway to improve the Race Street corridor near the Olympic National Park Visitor Center. The visitor center will remain open over the course of the project.

Alert: Heart O' the Hills Campground and Heart O' the Forest Trail temporarily closed
Description: The Heart O' the Hills Campground and Heart O' the Forest Trail will be closed from March 1 to May 12, 2023, during rehabilitation of water and wastewater systems.

Alert: Closure of recreational fishing in the Queets, Salmon, and Quinault Rivers
Description: Due to significant and ongoing conservation concerns, the Queets, Salmon, and Quinault Rivers will be closed to recreational fishing until June 1, 2023.

Alert: East Fork Quinault Trail Closed to Stock
Description: Due to repairs on the Pony Bridge, it will be impassable to stock. The trail will be closed to stock from September 14, 2022 until repairs are completed in the spring. Hikers will still be able to pass until the final stage of repairs.

Alert: Visitor Center Open Late on April 6th
Description: On April 6th the Visitor Center will open at 1pm. It will remain open until 4pm. We will resume our regular hours of 10am to 4pm on Friday.

Alert: Parking Garage at the Visitor Center
Description: If you need to use the Parking Garage at the Visitor Center, please enter through the far left bay to get your parking ticket. The middle bay has a broken printer and you will not be able to get the appropriate ticket from that bay.

Alert: Historic Homes Closed, Winter of 2022 to 2023
Description: Adams National Historical Park is now closed for Guided Tours. The historic homes are anticipated to reopen on May 3, 2023. The Visitor Center is open Monday to Friday, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Please call the Visitor Center at 617-770-1175 with any questions

Alert: Masks optional for parks in medium COVID-19 community level areas
Description: Norfolk County is in the MEDIUM (yellow) category for Covid-19 community transmission. Masks are not required in park buildings at this time. Individuals may wear a mask if they are so inclined.

Alert: Old Carriage Trail Bridge
Description: Approximately .3 miles from the northern trail entrance, the bridge is closed due to severe erosion of the bank underneath. No detour available. The 1.29 mile connector from the Towpath to the Bike and Hike trail is open.

Alert: Former Golf Course Property
Description: The former golf course property in Peninsula, including a section of the Valley Trail, is closed during environmental remediation.

Alert: Brandywine Falls Safety Alert
Description: Do not climb the rocks, over the fenced areas, or Brandywine Falls. Please enjoy Brandywine Falls safely by staying at least 50 feet from the top and bottom of the falls. Approaching too close can result in serious injury or death.

Alert: Lock 29 Overflow Parking
Description: Lock 29 Overflow Parking off Mill Street West in Peninsula is closed from March 24, 2023 to December 31, 2023.

Alert: Train Operations Suspended
Description: Cuyahoga Valley Scenic Railroad (CVSR) is suspending its modified train operations and spring activities in the park. Ongoing geotechnical soil monitoring in recent weeks identified increasing erosion along the tracks.

Alert: Boston Store Trailhead River Access Closure
Description: The Boston Store Trailhead River Access at mile marker 26.6 will be closed for construction of a pedestrian bridge over the Cuyahoga River. The closure will last from March 10, 2023 to June 18, 2023, this is subject to change.

Alert: Face masks required indoors in high COVID transmission counties
Description: The park spans Cuyahoga and Summit Counties in Ohio. If county transmission levels are high, masks are required inside Canal Exploration Center (Cuyahoga County), and/or Boston Mill Visitor Center (Summit County).

Alert: Expect Crowding
Description: Parking lots and popular destinations are crowded especially on weekends and days with warm weather between 10 a.m. and 3 p.m.

Alert: Paddling Hazard Upstream from Lock 39/Rockside Road
Description: A significant woody debris hazard exists near a set of metal pylons and timber groynes just upstream from the Lock 39/Rockside Rd. access. Do not attempt to paddle through during medium/low flow. Portage on river right. .

Alert: Current East Rim Trail Status
Description: Click "more" to find out if the East Rim Trail is open for today. In good conditions trail is open 6:00 a.m. - 11:00 p.m. for bikers and as posted for other trail users. In wet or hazardous conditions, the trail will close to all users to prevent damage.

Alert: Road to Rim Village is Temporarily CLOSED
Description: The road from Park Headquarters to Rim Village remains CLOSED due to large amounts of snow received during the most recent winter storm. There is no estimate for reopening at this time.

Alert: Crater Lake National Park is a Snow Zone
Description: Roads are plowed, but icy and snow covered. Crater Lake National Park is a Snow Zone - chains or traction tires are required when entering the park and must be the correct size and quantity for the vehicle. All ODOT regulations apply.

Alert: Steel Visitor Center is Closed for Construction
Description: The visitor center at park headquarters is currently closed for a major rehabilitation project. Restrooms are available at Rim Village and Goodbye Picnic Area.

Alert: Rim Drive and North Entrance Road Closed for the Season
Description: The park has closed Rim Drive, North Entrance and Pinnacles Roads for the winter season. Please be prepared for winter driving conditions.

Alert: High surf, rip currents, and heavy rainfall through the weekend.
Description: From Wednesday April 5, 2023, and running through Sunday April 9th, high winds and northerly swell are forecast to impact waters around Virgin Islands National Park resulting in potentially dangerous shore break and rip currents.

Alert: River Mountain Loop Trail Partial Closure - MM 11.5-20.5
Description: The River Mountain Loop will be closed for resurfacing and crack repair from mile marker 11.5 to approximately mile marker 20.5 from April 3 through July 30, 2023.

Alert: Temporary Closure - Echo Bay Primitive Dirt Launch Ramp
Description: Park facilities crews have encountered water-saturated silt that can trap vehicles at the primitive, dirt launch ramp at Echo Bay. For now, the area will be open to paddle craft only.

Alert: Katherine Landing Boat Fuel Access Changes
Description: Due to a modernization project, only land-based fuel is currently available at Katherine Landing for boats. Dock based fuel should be available again by Mid-April 2023.

Alert: Launch Ramp Conditions
Description: Get the most current launch ramp and water elevation conditions

Alert: Big Cypress National Preserve Issues Temporary Area Closure for the Cypress Trail Wildfire
Description: Big Cypress National Preserve has issued a temporary trail closure to promote visitor safety during current wildfire activity effective immediately, April 5, 2023. During the closure all recreational use are prohibited in the designated areas.

Alert: Trail Fire Smoke Impacts
Description: Smoke impacts from the Trail Wildfire are expected on I75 near mile marker 68. Please use caution when driving in the area.

Alert: Burn Ban in Effect Across Collier County
Description: Due to the ongoing Collier County Burn Ban, no open burning will be allowed in campgrounds at this time. Only smoke in areas free of combustible fuels and ensure cigarette is disposed of properly. Caution should be used when operating equipment

Alert: Seasonal Campground Closures
Description: Campgrounds may close seasonally, temporarily for repairs, or for resource concerns. For more information contact the Oasis Visitor Center at 239-695-4111 or the Nathaniel P. Reed Visitor Center at 239-695-695-4758 or visit our campground page.

Alert: Big Cypress National Preserve Open
Description: Big Cypress National Preserve has fully reopened following Hurricane Ian.

Alert: Oasis Visitor Center Hours Change
Description: The Oasis Visitor Center is now open Tuesday-Saturday from 9:00am-4:30pm. It will be closed Sunday-Monday. The bathrooms will remain open seven days a week.

Alert: Off Road Vehicle Inspections UPDATE: 5/27/22
Description: Beginning 5/27 ORV renewals & new permits will be issued at the Nathanial P. Reed Visitor Center Friday-Monday, 9am-1:30pm. No permits will be issued Tuesday-Thursday. Permits will be issued first-come first-served. Visit our ORV page for more information

Alert: Dangling Rope Marina Closed Indefinitely
Description: Due to significant wind damage and low water conditions, Dangling Rope Marina will not reopen in the immediate future. The damaged docks are not safe for visitors or employees. There is no estimated date for reopening.

Alert: No dock access to Rainbow Bridge Trail
Description: No dock access to the shoreline at Rainbow Bridge due to low water. Boats and small vessels beach at your own risk. Houseboats are too large to navigate the canyon. There are no services on the dock, which has been moved out of the way.

Alert: Security Closures
Description: Due to increased security measures, portions of the park will be closed at approximately 2 p.m. on Thursday, April 6. Closures are scheduled to continue through approximately 8 p.m. on Sunday, April 9, 2023. Check the "news" tab for further details.

Alert: Camp Greentop
Description: Due to ongoing construction to improve the visitor and group experience Camp Greentop is currently closed for renovation and rehabilitation. We anticipate an opening of late summer. For updates or inquiries please email, CATO_CampManager@nps.gov.

Alert: Winter Road Closures
Description: Park Central Road will be closed at various times throughout the winter due to inclement weather. Manahan (gravel) Road and Park Central Road (west of Manahan Road) will remain closed for the winter. Call the visitor center for updates 301-663-9388.

Alert: Trails Closed as of 4/5/23 at 12:00ET Due to Weather
Description: All trails will be closed as of 4/5/23 12:00 PM ET Due to Weather. Please check weather with National Weather Service before visiting park.
Park Name: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park

Alert: Weather Alert
Description: Severe weather alert 4/5/23 - please check weather with the National Weather Service for updates before visiting.
Park Name: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park

Alert: Kentucky Boyhood Home at Knob Creek Unit Visitor Center has Seasonal Hours
Description: The Knob Creek Visitor Center and Knob Creek Cabin are closed for winter season. The grounds at the Kentucky Boyhood Home at Knob Creek Unit are open from sunrise to sunset. The Visitor Center at the Birthplace Unit and Symbolic Cabin are open year round.
Park Name: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park

Alert: Birthplace Unit Open Daily!
Description: The Birthplace Visitors Center is open daily 9:00am to 5pm (ET) and the Memorial Building is open daily from 9:00am to 4:30pm (ET) Please be sure to ask about the Jr. Ranger Program for kids!
Park Name: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park

Alert: Boaters: Small Craft Advisory from 10 pm on Thursday, April 6 until 4 am on Friday, April 7.
Description: The Nat. Weather Service has issued a Small Craft Advisory for coastal waters between Point Arena and Point Reyes, including Tomales Bay. Winds of 21–33 knots (24–38 mph) and/or steep waves are expected to produce hazardous wave conditions to small craft.

Alert: Hazardous conditions along the tops and bases of coastal bluffs.
Description: In 2015, Arch Rock collapsed. In 2017, part of the bluff at Tomales Point collapsed. In 2023, sections of coastal bluffs throughout the park collapsed. Bluff tops may be unstable and additional collapses will & do occur. Stay on designated trails.

Alert: Temporary Closure of Drakes Beach and Limited Access to Drakes Beach Road and Parking Lot
Description: The Drakes Beach area and Drakes Beach Rd from Sir Francis Drake Blvd are closed to all vehicle, foot, & bicycle traffic from 4 pm to 10 am due to elephant seal activity at the parking lot. However, there may be access for seal viewing from 10 am to 4 pm.

Alert: Harbor Seal Pupping Season Closures are in effect from March 1 through June 30.
Description: From March 1 through June 30, the park implements closures of Drakes Estero, Double Point, & the western end of Limantour Spit to protect harbor seals during the pupping season. Please avoid disturbing seals to ensure a successful pupping season.

Alert: Pet Owners: Annual closure of a portion of Point Reyes Beach to pets from March 1 to September 30.
Description: Point Reyes Beach between the North Beach parking lot and Kehoe Beach Trail is closed to pets from March 1 to September 30 to better ensure the survival of snowy plover nests and chicks.

Alert: Delayed Open
Description: The park will open at 10am on Wednesday, 4/5, due to yesterday's snowstorm. Please drive safely when driving to the park as roads may be slick.

Alert: No Fuel Services
Description: Fuel up before visiting! Agate Fossil Beds National Monument is 30-50 miles from the nearest service stations.

Alert: Limited Cell Phone Coverage
Description: Cell phone voice and data coverage is very limited in the park and surrounding area. Free visitor WiFi is available in the visitor center.

Alert: Wednesday, April 5, 2023 - Sunny Today with a High of 38 °F (3 °C)
Description: Dry and warming weather expected for the remainder of the week. All trails into the canyon are snow-packed and icy. You will encounter snow drifts, icy slush, mud and fallen rocks from snowmelt. Foot traction and trekking poles are recommended.

Alert: What's Closed and What's Open This Week? —Wednesday April 5, 2023
Description: Coconino County is in CDC LOW Community Level —Face masks are not required this week, indoors or on park shuttle buses. The Visitor Center is CLOSED today. Follow the link for a list of the available services and their hours of operation.

Alert: Tree Removal Work Is Occurring for Multiple Construction Projects at the South Rim Until Early April
Description: Most of the work will be in administrative or residential areas and some will occur near Trailer Village and the Greenway Trail that connects to the town of Tusayan. Please adhere to any signs and construction flaggers during intermittent closures.

Alert: Gastrointestinal Illness Was Reported in Grand Canyon's Backcountry During 2022
Description: Prevent illness by proper hand washing and ensure the safety of your drinking water.

Alert: The North Rim is Closed for the Winter
Description: The North Rim will open for the 2023 season on May 15. Lodging reservations are recommended. Campground reservations are required.

Alert: Nāhuku (Thurston Lava Tube) Lights Out
Description: The lights inside Nāhuku (Thurston Lava Tube) are temporarily out. The lava tube remains open. Please bring a flashlight and use extra caution when entering.

Alert: Temporary Closure of Mauna Loa Road
Description: During the week of the 60th Annual Merrie Monarch Festival travel on the Mauna Loa Road will be restricted to hiking, biking and official motor vehicle traffic only. The closure dates are from 6:00 pm Friday, April 7th to 6:00 pm Sunday, April 16th.

Alert: Mauna Loa Trail Closed Above Red Hill Cabin
Description: Mauna Loa Trail, the summit cabin and wilderness area above Red Hill Cabin remain closed due to hazards from the recent eruption. Red Hill Cabin is open and requires a permit for overnight use.

Alert: Park Closure due to Winter Weather
Description: Badlands National Park and Highway 240 will be closed Wednesday, April 4th due to winter weather and poor road condtions. Travel is not advised. Please keep updated with road conditions and travel advisories throughout South Dakota.

Alert: Navigation
Description: Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.

Alert: Grand Portage NM Heritage Center and administrative offices closed April 5 due to severe weather
Description: The Grand Portage National Monument Heritage Center and administrative offices will be closed 4/5/2023 due to severe weather.

Alert: Winter is here!
Description: Grand Portage receives a significant amount of snow and high winds. Old Highway 61(County Road 17) is not plowed and seldom traveled. Please use caution or avoid this unmaintained road for the season. Also be mindful of trees falling if hiking in the area

Alert: Face masks are not required.
Description: Community transmission level is currently at LOW or MEDIUM: Mask wearing is optional for staff, visitors, or others, regardless of vaccination status.

Alert: Minuteman Missile NHS Closed April 4 and 5 Due to Winter Weather
Description: Minuteman Missile National Historic Site is closed 4/4-4/5/23 due to winter weather conditions.

Alert: Face Masks Are Optional
Description: Face masks are currently optional in all buildings at Minuteman Missile NHS.

Alert: Delta-01 Tour Fee and Reservations
Description: All Delta-01 Launch Control Facility Tours require advanced reservations. Reservations can be made up to 90 days in advance on-line or by phone at 605-717-7629. No SAME-DAY tours available during the summer season.

Alert: Warning about GPS Systems!
Description: Vehicle Navigation Systems and GPS units may provide inaccurate information—sending drivers the wrong way on one-way roads, leading them to dead ends in remote areas, or sending them on roads which are impassable. Use the Interstate exits for wayfinding.

Alert: Active Construction Underway on Tour Road Improvement Project
Description: Construction will begin on Tour Stops 6 and 10, along with minor work at other stops, this week. The Tour Road will be open during this work, but there will be localized closures. Please follow all signage and respect fences and closures.

Alert: Tour Stop 6 Closure - Wilkinson Trail Detour
Description: The tour road improvement project has reached Stop 6! Sections of the Wilkinson Trail in that area are closed to pedestrians. Please follow detour signs around Tour Stop 6 via the horse trail (See Map). Please observe any closed areas and do not enter.

Alert: Long Distance Phone Outage
Description: The park is unable to place long distance calls at this time. Incoming calls are still able to be answered. Alternatively, it is possible to contact the park via email

Alert: Starting August 1, 2023 Generators Only in Loop C
Description: Starting August 1, 2023 generator use will only be allowed in Loop C of the Fruita Campground.

Alert: Special Use Permits
Description: Special Use Permits are typically needed for activities that benefit a specific group. Examples include: Groups of 40 or more, trips organized by scouting groups, churches, or academic institutions, photography, weddings, and first amendment activities

Alert: Winter Conditions
Description: Some roads may be temporarily closed due to snow. Expect some snow and ice on roads. The river ford can be 12-20 inches deep. Slow down & drive carefully. Hiking trails can be icy. Traction devices that attach to your hiking shoes are highly recommended

Alert: Spring 2023 Prescribed Fire Burning Notice
Description: Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area may implement the following prescribed fire during the Spring of 2023. In Stevens County, the following location is slated for a prescribed burn: Gifford, 67 acres adjacent to the Gifford Campground and Boat Launch.

Alert: Evans Campground
Description: Evans campground and group site will be open April - July. It will close August 1st to complete work on the seawall.

Alert: Phase 3 of Cayuse Cove Stabilization Project begins 09/07/2022
Description: Beginning 09/07/2022 until the Memorial Day weekend the gravel parking lot and part of the paved boat launch at Porcupine Bay will be closed. Bureau of Reclamation is using these areas to load materials for a stabilization project upstream.

Alert: Extended Fish Cleaning Station Closure
Description: Park fish cleaning stations will remain closed while the NPS researches and tests better alternatives. This closure includes the restroom facility located at the Fort Spokane boat launch.

Alert: Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area
Description: Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice.

Alert: Chainsaw crew on the Minnehaha Bike Trail at Coldwater Spring and to the south of Coldwater
Description: A chainsaw crew is clearing downed trees and branches after the heavy snow over the weekend. Visitors should use caution when traveling along the trails due to tree damage. High winds are possible over the next few days that may dislodge broken branches.

Alert: Water and Bathrooms at the West Entrance Station
Description: Park rangers are working on the water filling station and the bathrooms at the West Entrance. Both the drinking water and bathrooms may be unavailable. Bring plenty of water with you before entering the park.

Alert: 49 Palms Trail Temporarily Closed
Description: The 49 Palms Trail will be temporarily closed for maintenance from January 9, 2023 to late April 2023. This closure will begin each week on Sunday at 10 pm and last until Thursday at 4 pm. The trail will be open to hikers Friday through Sunday.

Alert: COVID-19 Transmission Levels
Description: Check on COVID transimission levels in San Bernardino & Riverside County before you visit. Masks may be required inside of visitor centers regardless of vaccination status, consistent with CDC guidance regarding areas of substantial or high transmission.

Alert: Keys View Road Afternoon Closures
Description: Keys View Road often closes in the afternoon due to traffic and road conditions and frequently remains closed through sunset.

Alert: Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site visitor center closures - April 2023
Description: The Central High School NHS Visitor Center is open Tuesday through Saturday (10:00 a.m. CST/CDT to 4:00 p.m. CST/CDT). Guests may visit the NHS daily; use the NPS App for digital content on days when the visitor center is closed.
Park Name: Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site

Alert: Current Mask Policy in Visitor Center - week of April 2, 2023
Description: Consistent with CDC guidance regarding areas at a LOW COVID-19 community level, masks are OPTIONAL for visitors to Little Rock Central High School NHS, regardless of vaccination status, inside all park buildings.
Park Name: Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site

Alert: Parkway Closed Near Roanoke Due to Slope Failure
Description: The Parkway is closed to all uses from Milepost 121.4 (U.S. 220) to Milepost 135.9 (Adney Gap) due to a full road failure caused by heavy rains. Visit the associated news release for more information and a detailed detour map by clicking this alert

Alert: Closures Due to Weather
Description: Temporary weather-related closures may be in effect along the parkway. Please check the road and facility closure page for updates to the road status.

Alert: COVID-19 Mask Requirement
Description: The NPS has updated its masking guidance based on the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Masking requirements will vary along the parkway based on local conditions. Masks are still required on all forms of enclosed public transportation.

Alert: Administration Building Jug Fountain Temporarily Closed
Description: Due to a leak, the thermal water jug fountain in front of the park Administration Building on Reserve St. is temporarily closed. The sidewalk area around the fountain will also be inaccessible as our Maintenance staff repairs the leak.

Alert: Visitor Center Construction
Description: There is a door installation project in progress at the Visitor Center. Visitors will still be able to access the Visitor Center with minimal interruptions.
Park Name: Palo Alto Battlefield National Historical Park

Alert: Kolob Canyons Road partially closed
Description: The road is open as far as Taylor Creek Trailhead. No one (including drivers, hikers, and bikers) can go past this trailhead due to road damage. We will remove this alert when the road is opened. This does not affect Zion Canyon Shuttle System service

Alert: Avoid flash floods
Description: Flash floods are a sudden increase in the depth and speed of water in rivers, streams, or washes due to rain. Flood waters carry large debris like tree trunks and boulders and can happen at any time in Zion.

Alert: Avalanche risk for oversnow visitors on Kolob Terrace Road at and near Black Canyon
Description: Oversnow visitors such as snowshoers or skiers, or drivers of snowcats or snowmobiles, should be aware of the possibility of avalanche at and near Black Canyon. Learn more about seasonal changes to visits at Zion.

Alert: Toxic Cyanobacteria in the Virgin River and the streams of Zion National Park
Description: Do not submerge your head in or filter drinking water from still or moving water.

Alert: The Narrows--open from Temple of Sinawava, closed from Chamberlain's Ranch
Description: The Narrows is closed from Chamberlain's Ranch (for top-down travel) due to water flow above 120 cubic feet per second within the last 24 hours. The Narrows is currently open from the Temple of Sinawava (for up-and-back hikes).

Alert: Lava Point Road, Overlook, and Campground closed
Description: The Lava Point area is closed due to snow. This is a regular, seasonal closure, and we will remove this alert when snow melts.

Alert: Angels Landing Pilot Permit Program
Description: Everyone who hikes Angels Landing needs to have a permit. Learn why you need a permit and how to get one. This requirement does not affect entering the park or riding the park shuttle (when it is running).

Alert: Construction at South Entrance near Springdale
Description: There is one lane open into Zion and one lane open out of Zion at the park's south entrance. Expect delays entering the park. This is to accommodate drainage improvement work under the road.

Alert: Camp only in campgrounds
Description: If you camp in a vehicle in an area that is not a designated campground, you may get a citation. Learn more about opportunities to camp in Zion.

Alert: PARK CLOSED - TUZIGOOT FIRE
Description: Due to a fire within park boundary, the park is closed until further notice. Please visit our social media for updates and information. https://www.nps.gov/tuzi/learn/news/tuzigoot-fire-grows-to-100-acres.htm

Alert: Park Operations During Spring Break Feb. 26 - May 13.
Description: From Feb. 26 - May 13 the park will be in Spring Break Operations. Please be sure to plan for long lines, long waits and parking lots to be full. We ask the public to not park parallel, have passes and IDs ready, as well as exact change for entrance fee.

Alert: Masks are currently NOT REQUIRED when visiting Tuzigoot National Monument
Description: Requirements are dependent upon Community Level and based on data provided by the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention (CDC) for counties where the park is located. Yavapai County is currently LOW and Masks are NOT REQUIRED inside Federal Buildings.

Alert: Winter Storms and Impassable Road Conditions (Updated April 3, 2023)
Description: RAIN AND SNOW ON THE ARIZONA STRIP. Roads impassable above 5,000ft due to deep mud, snow, and ice. Mt. Trumbull, Whitmore Canyon, Twin Point, etc can't be reached safely. Roads to Pakoon Springs and Tassi Ranch require crossing flowing water in washes.

Alert: Grand Canyon-Parashant National Monument is not part of Grand Canyon National Park
Description: Grand Canyon National Park is only part of the 277 mile-long Grand Canyon. GC-Parashant starts on the north rim of the Grand Canyon west of Toroweap and stretches to the Nevada line. Click 'More' for the Grand Canyon National Park website.

Alert: Looking For A Grand Canyon View? A Warning About Cell Phone Navigation App Directions
Description: Cell phone map apps are directing people typing in "Grand Canyon" into Parashant. Parashant is unpaved for 4x4s vehicles, not cars, minivans, etc. No services or cell phone coverage here. See nps.gov/grca for roads to paved Grand Canyon viewpoints.

Alert: Requirements to drive a UTV (side-by-side) in Parashant if it is licensed in another State
Description: To use a UTV on the NPS section of the monument and Mohave County roads monument-wide, it must be registered and meet Arizona street legal (on-highway use) requirements including appropriate insurance and mandatory equipment. See More for Arizona regs.

Alert: Trees down on trails
Description: There are multiple trees down on trails, including Sugar Run and Object Lesson Road. Use caution.

Alert: Sugar Run & Chadwell Gap Trails Closed to Horses
Description: Sugar Run Trail and Chadwell Gap Trail are both closed to HORSES until further notice due to fallen trees.

Alert: Upcoming Civil War Trail Closure-North Loop
Description: Starting on April 17, 2023, the North Loop of the Glorieta Pass Civil War Battlefield Trail will close to all visitors for maintenance of seven bridges. The South loop will remain open. Maintenance is expected to take two months.

Alert: Uber, Lyft, and other "Taxi" Services
Description: While Pecos is close to Santa Fe and Las Vegas, services like Uber and Lyft may have limited availability to and from the park. If you are able to take an Uber or Lyft, please make sure you have plans to be picked up before being dropped off at Pecos.

Alert: Cave Tour Reservations Available & Strongly Recommended
Description: Advance cave tour reservations are available on recreation.gov through May 31st. June reservations will become available the first of May. The reservations close at noon the day before. Reservations are the best way to ensure tickets for your group.

Alert: Masks Not Required
Description: Masks are currently not required as Custer County is at a low transmission level for COVID-19.

Alert: Appropriate Footwear Required for Cave Tours
Description: Visitors are required to wear completely enclosed shoes if participating in a cave tour, like tennis shoes, sneakers or hiking boots. Any type of sandals or shoes with any openings are NOT acceptable.

Alert: Pet Restrictions in Effect March 15 through Labor Day
Description: Dogs and other pets are not allowed in the Otis Pike Fire Island High Dune Wilderness or on any of Fire Island's federally owned oceanfront beaches from March 15 through Labor Day to help protect threatened and endangered beach-nesting shorebirds.

Alert: The Fire Island Lighthouse Tower will be closed until further notice
COVID-19 Update: Masks optional within federal buildings.
Description: The CDC has recently reduced the COVID-19 Community Levels for Suffolk County to “Medium”. In accordance with the NPS’s masking guidance policy, masks are now optional inside all federal buildings regardless of vaccination status.

Alert: Eastern access to Backcountry Camping is closed
Description: Accessing Backcountry Camping through the Otis Pike Wilderness is temporarily closed due to beach conditions. The park will reassess and update accordingly.

Alert: Fire Island Lighthouse Maintenance
Description: The northeast corner of the Lighthouse Terrace will not be accessible due to ongoing maintenance in the area. The Keepers Quarters Museum and Gift Shop remain available.

Alert: William Floyd Estate
Description: The Old Mastic House is closed for renovations until further notice.

Alert: Possession or use of marijuana inside Fire Island National Seashore is prohibited.
Description: While New York provides for regulated possession and use of marijuana, it remains an illegal drug under federal law and enforced within National Park units.

Alert: Shuttle drivers needed! Apply now!
Description: Carl Sandburg Home seeks motor vehicle operators to drive the park’s 5-7 passenger wheelchair accessible visitor shuttle. All training will be provided. Applications accepted through April 7. Click to learn more and how to apply.
Park Name: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site

Alert: Sandburg Home Visitor Center/Park Store and Tours Open Saturday and Sunday
Description: The Visitor Center/Park Store is open Sat and Sun from 10am-4pm. Tours are available at 11am, 1pm, 2pm. Tour reservations strongly recommended at Recreation.gov. Day-of-visit tickets rarely available.
Park Name: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site

Alert: Pedestrian Bridge at Front Lake is Closed
Description: The pedestrian bridge at the main entrance to the park is closed. During the closure, visitors must walk an additional 0.4 mile around Front Lake, and then 1/3 mile up a hill to the Sandburg Home and farm. For accessibility options, call 828-707-8125.
Park Name: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site

Alert: Sections of moat wall closed to snorkeling
Description: From April to June, approximately one-half of the moat wall will be closed to snorkeling during coral relocation work. Signs will be posted and closed areas will be marked with swim lanes. Beaches and moat walkway remain open.

Alert: Closures on parts of Garden Key and Loggerhead Key
Description: Until further notice, all finger piers and slips, and the dinghy beach between the finger piers and the South Coaling Dock are closed on Garden Key. On Loggerhead Key, the Historic Preservation/Adaptive Use zone around the lighthouse is closed.

Alert: Migrant Notice
Description: Like elsewhere in the Florida Keys, we have recently seen an increase in Cuban migrants arriving by boat from Cuba and landing on the islands of Dry Tortugas National Park. You may observe migrant landings at the park and visitor areas may be impacted.

Alert: Bait boxes in the park contain rat poison.
Description: Dry Tortugas staff are carrying out a Rat Management Plan to prevent reintroduction of invasive rats. Rodenticide is harmful to pets if ingested. Keep all pets on leashes and contact park staff if you see rats or suspect your pet has ingested rodenticide.

Alert: Garden Key Harbor Light
Description: Vessel operators - the Garden Key Harbor Light is undergoing repairs and is extinguished. At this time it is unknown when the light will again be illuminated.

Alert: Traffic delays

Alert: Fuel Unavailable
Description: Pumps at Big Meadows Wayside, the Park's only gas station, are closed for upgrades. Fuel will not be available inside the Park. Please arrive with a full tank before you enter.

Alert: South River & Dundo Picnic Grounds and Campground Water Alert
Description: Water testing at South River and Dundo Picnic Grounds and Dundo Campground shows water may contain microbial contamination. Water should NOT be consumed or used for washing dishes and hands without boiling it first.

Alert: Thornton Gap Entrance Station
Description: Due to damage caused by a vehicle fire, cash cannot currently be accepted at this entrance station. Credit, debit, and electronic payments only. Vehicles over 11 feet tall will need to stop for assistance and/or be careful to follow signage.

Alert: Ticket Required to Hike Old Rag
Description: March 1 - November 30 those wishing to hike Old Rag are required to purchase a day-use ticket before arriving.

Alert: Riprap Boundary Access Closure

Alert: Jeremy's Run Trail from the boundary
Description: The boundary access to Jeremy's Run Trail across private property at State Route 611 is temporarily closed by the landowner. The park trail remains open. Hikers must access Jeremy's Run from Skyline Drive. The park is working to resolve the situation.

Alert: Temporary Facility Closures
Description: Fort Barrancas, Opal Beach Complex Restrooms Pavilion A, C, and E are closed.

Alert: Electric Vehicle Charging
Description: While the campgrounds at Gulf Islands have sites equipped with electricity, our systems do not currently support the charging of electric vehicles.

Alert: No Dogs on Beach
Description: Dogs and pets are not allowed on any of the beaches in Gulf Islands National Seashore. Visit the pet rules page for information.

Alert: Rip Current Status
Description: Review rip current status prior to visiting the park.

Alert: Fee Stations Credit Card Only
Description: Fee Stations are only accepting credit cards for the purchase of passes. Visitors can also purchase digital passes in advance at www.recreation.gov/sitepass/74285

Alert: Sieur de Monts Parking Area Closed
Description: The parking area at Sieur de Monts is closed due to ongoing flooding.

Alert: Carriage roads closed for mud season

Alert: Cadillac Summit Road closed to all uses
Description: Cadillac Summit Road will be closed to all use through mid-May due to construction.

Alert: Several Trails Close For Peregrine Falcon Nesting Season

Alert: Historic Cant Ranch Home & Museum Hours

Park Name: John Day Fossil Beds National Monument

Alert: Rocks in Road Through Picture Gorge
Description: Use caution, especially at hours with low visibility, while driving through Picture Gorge because rocks of various sizes frequently fall onto the road from the basalt canyon walls. Alert a Park Ranger of any moderate to severe rock falls.
Park Name: John Day Fossil Beds National Monument

Alert: Checking Winter Road Conditions Prior to Visit
Description: Heading to John Day Fossil Beds soon and want to know what the road conditions are or if winter tires/chains restrictions are enforced? Check various highway cameras across Oregon on TripCheck.com, run by Oregon Dept. of Transportation.
Park Name: John Day Fossil Beds National Monument

Alert: Cattle on the Road to Painted Hills
Description: Use caution on Burnt Ranch Road between Highway 26 and the Painted Hills entrance. Cattle may be on or near the roadway for the duration of March and through April.
Park Name: John Day Fossil Beds National Monument

Alert: Ravine Trial Closed

Park Name: Craters Of The Moon National Monument & Preserve

Alert: Loop Road and Campground Closed to Vehicles

Park Name: Craters Of The Moon National Monument & Preserve

Alert: Winter Grooming Operations Have Begun

Park Name: Craters Of The Moon National Monument & Preserve

Alert: Water Off in the Campground

Park Name: Craters Of The Moon National Monument & Preserve

Alert: Navigation

Park Name: Craters Of The Moon National Monument & Preserve

Alert: Rip Currents and Rough Surf

Alert: Restricted Access to Eagle Nesting Area

Alert: COVID-19 Mask Requirement

Alert: Visitor Center Closed 4/2/23

Alert: COVID-19 mask requirement as of 4/01/2023

Description: Ajo Mountain Drive, a 21-mile one-way road will close on April 3, 2023 through the end of the month to finish a road improvement project that began last fall. This multi-phased project will improve the visitor use and experience of the road.

Alert: Alamo Canyon Campground Opens For Advanced Reservations January 1, 2023
Description: Alamo Canyon Campground will be available year-round, beginning January 1, 2023 for reservations on www.recreation.gov or by calling 877-444-6777. This change will make it possible for visitors to reserve their ideal campsite prior to their arrival.

Alert: Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed
Description: El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.

Alert: Road Work on South Puerto Blanco, Pozo Nuevo and Bates Well Roads via Darby Well.
Description: Road crews with heavy equipment will be working on the South Puerto Blanco to Pozo Road then north to Bates Well Road via Darby Well Road. Use caution, drive slow, and follow instructions from road crews when directed to pass.

Alert: Lowndes Interpretative Center Closed as of 3/23/23
Description: Due to a water main break, the Lowndes Interpretive Center is closed as of March 23, 2023. This center will remain closed until at least Wednesday, April 12, 2023. The Selma and Montgomery Interpretive Centers are open during normal operating hours.
Park Name: Selma To Montgomery National Historic Trail

Alert: Visitor Center Phones Down
Description: Phones at the Selma Interpretive Center are currently down. Please call the Montgomery Interpretive Center at (334)293-0597 for questions or to make a reservation for a group visit at any of our visitor centers.
Park Name: Selma To Montgomery National Historic Trail

Alert: Walk Through the Ruins Trail improvements.
Description: The Walk Through the Ruins Trail is being improved as the Path of the Flood Trail is being built in the lakebed. While it remains open, it is an active project and may briefly close for short periods of time. Portions are the trail are very wet and muddy.

Alert: Western Gulls Nesting on Anacapa Island From April Through Mid-August
Description: During this time, visitors will encounter seabird rookery conditions: guano, strong odor, constant noise, bird carcasses, and birds protecting their territory. If visitors consider these conditions adverse, it is advised that they visit another island.

Alert: Wet Creek Crossing at Canada Del Puerto, Prisoner's Harbor and Water Canyon, Santa Rosa Island
Description: During winter and spring, visitors need to be prepared for a wet creek crossing at Canada del Puerto in Prisoner's Harbor. The footbridge at Water Canyon on Santa Rosa Island has washed out and currently requires a wet creek crossing as well.

Alert: Closure to Off-Trail Burn Area at East Santa Cruz Island
Description: Scorpion Anchorage is open for day and overnight visitation. Hiking is still allowed on the Smugglers Cove Road. However, the nearby off-trail Scorpion Fire burn area of approximately 1,411 acres will be closed for restoration until further notice.

Alert: Avoid Chinese Harbor
Description: Visitors should avoid Chinese Harbor Road below the intersection of the Del Norte Trail while marine debris is removed from a recent vessel grounding.

Alert: Santa Barbara Island Closed Due to Storm Damage
Description: Santa Barbara Island is closed to public access due to dock building damage from the recent storms.

Alert: The Visitor Center is closed due to construction projects.

Alert: Mask Status in Park Buildings – Masks OPTIONAL– Week of March 31 - April 7, 2023
Description: The NPS has updated its mask guidance to align with the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Each Friday, the park will update the mask status for the upcoming week. This park spans 2 counties and will follow guidance for the county with higher levels.

Alert: Jan 10, 2023 Update - Increasing Access to Visitor Center and Museum
Description: Kings Mountain NMP Visitor Center hours are Wednesday through Sunday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Public restrooms and park grounds are open 7 days per week 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily.

Alert: Mask Status in Park Buildings – Masks OPTIONAL– Week of March 31 - April 7, 2023
Description: The NPS has updated its masking guidance to align with the CDC’s new COVID-19 Community Levels tool, which helps communities decide what prevention steps to take. Each Friday, the park will update the mask status here for the upcoming week.

Alert: 1/15/2023 - Increasing Access to Visitor Center and Museum
Description: Beginning Sunday, Jan. 15, 2023, the visitor center at Cowpens NB will be open daily Wednesday to Sunday from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm. Restrooms and park grounds are open 7 days per week, except on federal holidays specified in the superintendent’s compendium.

Alert: 2023 Train Schedule and Tickets
Description: Steamtown NHS train rides resume for the season on Thursday, May 11, 2023.

Alert: Temporary Building Closures in Effect: Park Remains Open to Visitors
Description: The roundhouse, railyard, and grounds remain open to visitors. The following buildings are temporarily closed due to issues with our heating system: Visitor Center, Theater, History Museum, and Technology Museum.

Alert: Restrooms during Temporary Closures
Description: During the temporary closures of the Visitor Center, Theater, History Museum, and Technology Museum, there will be no public access to heated bathrooms or running water. Portable toilets will be available outside.

Alert: CLOSED: Walkway to Steamtown Mall
Description: The walkway between Steamtown NHS and the Marketplace at Steamtown Mall has closed for the season. There is now NO pedestrian access to Steamtown NHS.

Alert: Diablo Lake Boat Launch Inaccessible to Powerboats
Description: Due to silt accumulation, the Diablo Lake boat launch at Colonial Creek South Campground is not usable for launching most powerboats. Expect shallow or no water at the launch ramp and the possibility of needing to carry your boat to or from the water.

Alert: State Route 20 Closed for the Winter
Description: State Route 20 is closed at milepost 134 (Ross Dam Trailhead) for the season. Visitors can access the closed portion of the highway during the winter season. Park in designated parking areas, do not block the gate.

Alert: Cascade River Road Emergency Closure MP6
Description: Cascade River Road is closed at milepost 6 (USFS boundary) due to a rockslide.

Alert: Cascade River Road Closed for the Season
Description: Cascade River Road is closed for the winter season at milepost 20 (Eldorado), three miles before the trailhead. Do not block the road and gate when parking.

Alert: Trail and Camp Closures Due to Fire Activity
Description: For closures due to fire activity visit the Fire Closures page.

Alert: Be Aware of Break-ins along State Route 20
Description: Prevent smashed windows and theft. Break-ins are not uncommon at trailheads along State Route 20. Remove your valuables and electronics and take associated electronic cords.

Alert: North Fork and South Fork Areas May Be Inaccessible Due to Flooding From Winter Storms
Description: Flooding, debris slides, and landslides from winter have caused damage along roads leading to two remote areas in the foothills of Sequoia National Park. Roads to these areas may be closed, impassable, or difficult to navigate during any storm.

Alert: All Entrances to Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks Are Closed
Description: All roads are closed due to significant storm damage. Kings Canyon National Park is projected to reopen in mid-April. The Foothills area of Sequoia National Park is projected to open in mid-April, and the Giant Forest in late May via Highway 180

Alert: Deer and elk along Highway 50

Description: Climbers be advised that falcon nesting season is upon us. Presently there are no formal closures. Please check back for updates. Report any nests and avoid disturbances to said nests: deto_interpretation@nps.gov & 307-467-5283x637

Alert: News Releases
Description: Stay up to date with the latest big news items from Devils tower National Monument

Alert: Bandelier access by shuttle only 9 am to 3 pm mid May - mid October, 2023

Alert: Too Many Visitors, Not Enough Parking

Alert: Temporary Closure of Bandelier's Tsankawi Unit Begins April 3, 2023, Rest of Park Remains Open

Description: The Coyote Loop of Juniper Family Campground and the RV Dump Station will be closed until late spring 2023.

Alert: Uber, Lyft, and other "Taxi" services

Alert: The Phones Lines are Down, Please Email Us
Description: The phone lines for Hagerman Fossils Beds National Monument are currently being repaired. To contact a ranger, please send an email to hafo_information@nps.gov

Alert: Use Caution with GPS Navigation

Alert: Road Closures

Alert: Highway 50 Construction

Park Name: Black Canyon Of The Gunnison National Park

Description: the Soda Lake crossing on Mojave backcountry road is CLOSED due to wet, muddy conditions. drivers could be held financially liable for resource damage and vehicle extraction costs. Use detour via Rasor Rd., Interstate 15, & Kelbaker Rd.

Alert: All of Kelbaker Road OPEN; Hole in the Wall requires access via I-40 and Essex Road.
Description: GPS apps are not updating the Kelbaker Road opening, do not follow GPS, use direct route on Kelbaker Road between Kelso and Baker. Black Canyon Road CLOSED North of Hole in the Wall. Only Essex Rd & I-40 accesses the Hole in the Wall Area

Alert: Cima Road CLOSED from Cima to I-15. Do Not Drive on this road
Description: Cima Road is CLOSED from Interstate 15 to Kelso Cima Road until March 2024 due to construction. Please use alternate routes. Teutonia Peak and other Cima Dome attractions are accessible only with expert routefinding on backcountry 4WD only roads.

Alert: Outdoor Water Not Available in Campground
Description: Due to below freezing temperatures, the outdoor spigots in the campground are shut off. Bathrooms are open. A spigot is available behind the visitor center, near stairs to the back porch.

Alert: Restroom Closures
Description: The restrooms at the campground and picnic area will be closed in stages during renovation. The project will run from 3/27 to 4/30/23. Portable toilets are available, and one restroom will remain open while the other is being worked on.

Alert: New Parking Measures at Museum and Visitor Center Take Effect on April 1
Description: New parking measures will take effect at the Museum & Visitor Center on April 1, 2023. These measures are necessary due to the ongoing road construction on Visitor Center Drive from Taneytown Road to the Visitor Center. See attached map for more details.

Alert: Little Round Top Rehabilitation Project Closure Notice
Description: The construction contractor closed Little Round Top on Tuesday, July 26. All road closures & detours have gone into effect. Little Round Top will be CLOSED for 18 months.

Alert: Frozen Lake Access Proposal open comment period will be open through May 3, 2023
Description: The park will host public meetings discussing our frozen lake access Preliminary proposal. Park staff will give a presentation and will then be available to answer questions from the public. Click more below for meeting dates and further information.

Alert: Park Headquarters Building Access
Description: The park headquarters building may be entered Monday through Friday 8 - 4:30 pm. Located on the park entrance doors are phones numbers to gain access.

Alert: New Vessel Decontamination Procedures
Description: Voyageurs National Park management will now require all vessels crossing the Kettle Falls Portage from Rainy Lake to Namakan Lake to be decontaminated by trained staff beginning May 13, 2022. Visitors may experience delays when portaging at this area.

Alert: Salmi Road entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail Temporarily Closed
Description: Salmi Road entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail out of the Kabetogama community is temporarily closed. Access to the trail remains open Ash River Trail, the Meadwood Road, and at the eastern most terminus of the trail within the community of Ash River.

Alert: Cranberry Creek to Locator Lake Trail is closed
Description: The Cranberry Creek to Locator Lake trail is closed until further notice due to beaver damming and flooding which is making the trail impassable. Signs are posted at the trail entrance.

Alert: Jamestown Island Loop Closed April 1 thru June 15
Description: The Loop Drive on Jamestown Island in Colonial National Historical Park will be CLOSED to vehicles this year from April 1st until June 15th to allow turtles to move safely through their natural wetland habitat. Pedestrians and Bicycles are permitted.

Alert: Temporary closure of Ringfield Pullout until further notice for shoreline stabilization construction
Description: Effective March 7, 2023, Ringfield Pullout and river access will be closed to all visitors until further notice for shoreline stabilization construction. The Powhatan Village and Indian Field Creek Pullouts remain open as alternate access to York River.

Alert: Jamestown Island Loop Closed April 1 thru June 15
Description: The Loop Drive on Jamestown Island in Colonial National Historical Park will be CLOSED to vehicles this year from April 1st until June 15th to allow turtles to move safely through their natural wetland habitat. Pedestrians and Bicycles are permitted.
Park Name: Historic Jamestowne Part of Colonial National Historical Park

Alert: Akers Ferry-State Highway K- CLOSED until further notice
Description: CLOSED until further notice

Alert: Temporary Closure of Chubb Hollow, including pavilion, group sites and trail access
Description: A temporary closure of the Chubb Hollow area, including pavilion, group camping sites and trail access is in effect. This closure is due to renovation of the area in conjunction with the Big Spring Lodge and Cabins project.

Alert: Temporary Closure of Tram Road (NPS 123)
Description: NPS Road 123 (Tram Road) is temporarily CLOSED due to roadway collapse from heavy rainfall. The roadbed and adjacent bank are unstable due to saturated soil. Road will reopen when repairs have been completed.

Alert: Visitor Contact Station Closed For Season
Description: The visitor contact station at Munising Falls is closed for the season. Click "More" to buy park passes online. Information/map boards are set up in the Munising Falls parking lot.

Alert: Park Entrance Fee Increase
Description: Park entrance fees will increase beginning January 1, 2023. See the park fee web page for more information.

Alert: Other Closures
Description: All the park's drive-in campgrounds are closed for the season. All vault toilets in the park have been shut down, except at Sand Point and Grand Sable Visitor Center parking lot. Flush toilet at Munising Falls remains open.

Alert: Miners Beach Staircase Closed
Description: The main staircase at Miners Beach (closest to the west end parking lot) was damaged in the 10/18/22 storm and is not usable. There are two other staircases leading down to the beach, at the east and west ends of the beach.

Alert: Winter/Spring Road Conditions
Description: Park roads & eastern portion of H-58 are not plowed in winter. Roads open when snow melts (usually April/May). Spring conditions: snow, freezing rain, trees down, snowmobile studs on roads, black ice, and mud.

Alert: Timed Entry Reservation Pilot 2023
Description: To enter the park from April 1 to October 31, 2023, visitors need a Timed Entry Ticket. We encourage you to reserve yours on Recreation.gov up to three months prior to visiting. Extra tickets become available for day-before purchase.

Alert: Vegetation Pile Burning Possible
Description: When weather permits, we may burn vegetation piles near park roads. Burns are being completed in order to consume existing woody and herbaceous material from exotic plant management projects in the park.

Alert: Vegetation Pile Burns Possible
Description: When weather permits, we may burn vegetation piles near park roads. Burns are being completed in order to consume existing woody and herbaceous material from exotic plant management projects in the park.

Alert: Hazardous Trail Conditions
Description: Many hiking trails are snow-covered and icy, over-the-shoe traction devices are recommended.

Alert: Expect long lines to enter the park
Description: Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.

Alert: Difficult conditions complicate Cataract Canyon takeouts
Description: Hite Ramp is closed. The North Wash take-out is a primitive, unimproved dirt take-out. You will not be able to back a trailer down the dirt slope. Recent washouts have further deteriorated conditions.

Alert: Partial Trail Closures Due to Ice and Snow
Description: The Headland Trail is open to Atsinna Pueblo and across the mesa top. The north side of the trail remains closed due to icy conditions. The Inscription Loop Trail is open to Marker #16.

Alert: Park Closed Tuesdays and Wednesdays
Description: The visitor center and all park trails are closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Open Thursday through Monday, from 9 am - 5 pm. Hiking park trails is not permitted when the park is closed.

Alert: Offseason Reminder
Description: At this time of year, the visitor center and park trails are entirely closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Please plan accordingly.

Alert: Water in Campground is Shut Off
Description: The water in the campground has been shut off for the winter due to freezing temperatures. Visitors are encouraged to bring their own supply. Small water containers may also be filled in the visitor center during business hours (9 am - 5 pm).

Alert: Road Conditions (3/26/23)
Description: CR 7950 and Highway 57 have dried out after the steady rains last week, making both roads passable. Continue to use caution when entering and exiting the park. Please call the visitor center (505-786-7014) for any recent changes to road conditions.

Alert: Mesa Verde Closures
Description: While much of the park is open, Mesa Verde has several safety and project-related closures in place, including the Wetherill Mesa Road, the Chapin Mesa Museum, and Spruce Tree House. Follow the link for more information.

Alert: Winter Conditions
Description: Winter weather is variable at Mesa Verde. Snow is always possible and icy conditions will sometimes close the park road. All activities depend on road, trail, and weather conditions. Check https://www.facebook.com/mesaverdenps/ for current conditions.

Alert: NPS 300 Road Conditions
Description: NPS 300 to Big Tubes is currently rutted, icy, and muddy in many places. High clearance is highly recommended and four-wheel drive is likely required. We do not recommend travel on this road or on Co Rd 42 while snow persists or while snow melts.

Alert: All Lava Tube Caves Closed November 1st Through April 30th
Description: All park lava tube caves are closed for the winter from November 1st through April 30th to protect hibernating bats. This closure does not affect the Junction Bridge Cave at the start of El Calderon Trail.

Alert: General Operating Hours Udate
Description: Due to staffing, the site will continue with its Wednesday through Sunday, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. schedule until further notice. On days with limited staffing, Homestead tours may be offered at 11:30 and 2:30 with the Visitor Center closed during tour times.

Alert: Depot Street Work/Closures
Description: The town of Greeneville is working on roads adjacent to the Visitor Center. This may impact your ability to access the site and parking lot. Call 423-638-3551 for more information, or check the website provided.

Alert: Notice to travelers to National Cemetery
Description: Due to the narrow roadway & tight turn, RVs, mobile homes, charter buses, delivery trucks, or vehicles with trailers are prohibited from the crest of Monument Hill. Check for information about parking at the Visitor Center upon your arrival.

Alert: 2023 Firefly Viewing Event Dates and Information
Description: The 2023 Firefly Viewing Event will take place from May 13-16 and May 19-24. Please see our event information page for details on entering the lottery for an event pass.

Alert: RVs, Trailers and Other Oversized Vehicles (Limited Parking)
Description: Due to increased visitation, parking lots often fill up early. Visitors need to be aware that parking for larger vehicles is very limited. RVs using "tow dollies" may have to unhook towed vehicles in order to turn around in the parking lot on busy days.

Alert: Being Prepared for a Wilderness Experience
Description: Some of the park's trails require advanced navigation (compass & maps), climbing over downed trees & crossing through water. Please choose trails that fit your preferences & abilities. Visit the Trail Information page to learn more about the park's trails

Alert: Be aware of changing beach conditions
Description: Beach conditions can change without warning. Check current tide charts and weather forecasts before traveling on the beach.

Alert: 4-wheel drive required for beach driving
Description: 4-wheel drive is required for driving on North and South Beach.

Alert: Big Bend Spring = Full Campgrounds
Description: March is the busiest time of the year in Big Bend. Please plan ahead and do NOT travel all the way to Big Bend without camping/lodging arrangements. Be prepared for full parking and busy facilities. Select "more" below for further details.

Alert: Safety Alert: Santa Elena Canyon Trail
Description: Depending upon recent rains, Terlingua Creek may be dry sand, thick mud, or flowing water. Carefully assess conditions before attempting to cross. Follow trail signs for the correct crossing location. Do NOT Cross at other locations.

Alert: Tuff Canyon TRAIL CLOSURE
Description: The Tuff Canyon Trail and overlooks are CLOSED to entry until further notice, due to a rock fall and unstable slopes.

Alert: Temporary Trail Closure to Protect Nesting Falcons
Description: From February 1st through May 31st, a portion of the East Rim Trail in the Chisos Mountains will be closed to protect nesting falcons. The closure includes East Rim backpacking campsites ER-4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9. For details and a map, click "more."

Alert: Big Bend is a NO DRONE Zone
Description: The use of drones is prohibited in Big Bend National Park. Thank you for preserving the peace and tranquility of Big Bend.

Alert: Bringing a Pet to Big Bend?
Description: Bringing your pet to Big Bend National Park will limit some of your park explorations and opportunities. Pets are not allowed on park trails, in the backcountry, or on the river. Pets are allowed only where vehicles can go. Pets may not be left unattended

Alert: Signal Hill Picnic Area upcoming closure (Tucson Mountain District)
Description: Signal Hill Picnic Area will be closed to all traffic during construction to improve accessibility. The project is expected to begin in late April and take 4-6 months. Signal Hill itself will remain accessible by foot.

Alert: Vehicle Break-Ins
Description: Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity.

Alert: Rideshare services should be used with caution if visiting the West side (Tucson Mountain District)
Description: Rideshare services will drop visitors off at the park, but usually will not pick them back up. To avoid being stranded in the park, coordinate two-way trips before using rideshares to visit the West side. No major trails start at the visitor center.

Alert: Accessibility lifts and elevator inoperable
Description: At this time, accessibility lifts and interior elevator at the birth house are inoperable. We are looking to fix them as soon as possible. Check this site for further information or updates.
Park Name: Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace National Historic Site

Alert: Phone out of order
Description: The Theodore Roosvelt Birthplace National Historic Site telephone is, currently, down. If you have any questions about our site please reach out to us through the contact link on our webpage or DM us through Facebook
Park Name: Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace National Historic Site

Alert: Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace Reopens to the Public
Description: On Wednesday, 9/7/2022, Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace reopens for public viewing with a modified tour schedule. In observance of COVID protocol, visitors are asked to wear masks and observe social distancing when required.
Park Name: Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace National Historic Site

Alert: Fort Davis NHS is a NO DRONE Zone!
Description: The use of drones is prohibited at Fort Davis National Historic Site. Thank you for preserving the cultural landscape.

Alert: Fort Davis NHS is in the Central Time Zone
Description: Fort Davis National Historic Site is located in the Central Time Zone. The park is open 8:00 am until 5:00 pm (Central Time). The Visitor Center closes at 4:30pm. The Main Gate locks at 5:00pm.

Alert: Winter Trail Closures
Description: The entire Navajo Loop and the 1.5-mile section of Rim Trail between Inspiration and Bryce Points are both currently closed. All other frontcountry trails remain open for hiking.

Alert: Main Road Status
Description: The Main Road is open to Bryce Point (Mile 3 of 18); see Current Conditions below for more information. Roads to Fairyland Point and Paria View are closed for the winter.

Alert: No Entry Reservations Required
Description: No reservations are required to enter Bryce Canyon. Simply pay your park entrance fee or present your America the Beautiful pass upon arrival. Click "More" to purchase a Digital Pass, which delivers you entrance pass directly to your device.

Alert: Parking lot repair and gate closure
Description: Beginning Wednesday, March 22, 2023, repair work to the parking lot will require closing the driveway gate to the accessible parking spaces at the top of the Ranch HQ hill for upwards of six weeks as the newly poured concrete cures.

Alert: Visitor Contact Station Moved to the Historic House
Description: Rangers are stationed in the Historic House while Visitor Center and parking areas are upgraded. Completion currently estimated sometime in the spring of 2023. Follow posted signs.

Alert: Caution - Construction Zone
Description: Please use caution and follow signs as you enter the parking lot. Follow signs to reach the historic ranch site. A 10 minute film is inside the barn. Please use caution and be safe.

Alert: Dangerous Highway Crossing
Description: Highway 177 is 60 mph with a blind spot directly across from the house. Safely use the highway underpass to the Fox Creek Trail just south of the visitor center parking lot. Be smart, stay alive.

Alert: Wild Bison
Description: Bison graze in both Windmill and West Traps pastures. Sightings may be at schoolhouse parking area. Bison will defend themselves if they feel threatened. Keep 100 yards distance. A raised tail is a warning sign: bison may charge or give chase.

Alert: 2023 Washington Monument & Old Post Office Tower
Description: Planned closures for maintenance work monthly: Thu, Apr. 6; Tue, May 2; Mon, Jun. 5; Fri, Jul. 7; Thu, Aug. 3; Tue, Sept. 5; Mon, Oct. 2; Fri, Nov. 3; Tue, Dec 5. We are also closed on the Christmas Day Holiday.

Alert: Steel Creek Ranger Station Closed
Description: The Steel Creek Ranger Station is closed at this time due to inadequate staffing levels. It will be re-opened later this year as staffing allows. Call the Tyler Bend Visitors Center at 870-439-2502 for updates.

Alert: Drinking Water Not Available at Rush Campground
Description: Starting March 15, water will not be available at Rush Campground. Please plan accordingly if you are planning to camp at Rush or utilize the water spigot before embarking into the Lower Wilderness.

Alert: Parking is not permitted on the Kyles Landing Road (County Road 56)
Description: Starting March 1, 2023, there will be ‘No Parking’ signs placed along the Kyles Landing Road, also known as County Road 56. Parking will no longer be permitted on the road to allow space for emergency vehicles to safely enter the park.

Alert: South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available
Description: In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open. The National Park Service, in coordination with Searcy County, will work to reopen the road as soon as possible.

Alert: Park Phone Number has Changed to 912-219-4233
Description: The park phone number is now 912-219-4233. The old number will not be monitored and will direct callers to the new number. Thank you for your patience.

Alert: Cockspur Island Lighthouse and Lighthouse Island are Closed
Description: Due to ongoing preservation efforts, the lighthouse and lighthouse island are closed to the public.

Alert: The North Shoreline is Closed
Description: The shoreline is closed permanently for resource protection and visitor safety.

Alert: Fort Pulaski Entrance Fees are Credit/Debit Only
Description: The park is no longer accepting cash for entrance fees. Credit and debit cards are the only method of payment currently being accepted.

Alert: Drones are Prohibited in Fort Pulaski National Monument
Description: The use of drones or other remote-controlled unmanned aircraft, is prohibited in the park for issues relating to visitor safety and experience, and wildlife and resource protection. For more info, see section 1.5(a)(1) of the Superintendent's Compendium.

Alert: Visitor Center moved to Bishop Reverdy C. Ransom Memorial Library at Payne Theological Seminary
Description: As of 10/31/2021, all visitor services are now operating from the Bishop Reverdy C. Ransom Memorial Library on the Payne Theological Seminary campus due to the renovation of the historic Young house. House tours will NOT be available for the duration
Park Name: Charles Young Buffalo Soldiers National Monument

Alert: SAFETY ADVISORY
Description: Please DO NOT attempt to access or park a vehicle at the Charles Young house site. It is an active construction zone closed to visitors. There are no areas for visitors to park any vehicles and/or walk on the grounds. Proceed to the temp. visitor center.
Park Name: Charles Young Buffalo Soldiers National Monument

Alert: Possible Rabies Advisory
Description: Reports of raccoons acting strangely around visitors at Lock 34 (MP 61.5). Do not approach or touch wildlife. If visitors see sick or erratically behaving wildlife, call the park's 24-hour emergency Dispatch Center at 866-677-6677.
Park Name: Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park

Alert: Phone Outage: Contact Information
Description: To reach a ranger, visitors should call 301-714-2238 or email choh_information@nps.gov, due to maintenance on the park's phone system from March 15 and April 1.
Park Name: Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park

Alert: Equestrian Traffic Temporarily Prohibited Milepost 137.8-140.7
Description: Horses are prohibited between MP 137.8 and Fifteen Mile Creek (MP 140.7) due to recent and ongoing towpath resurfacing. See more for details.
Park Name: Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park

Alert: Phased reopening – COVID-19 Update
Description: We are working to increase access to the park in a phased approach. Masks are REQUIRED in certain areas of the park. Click the link and scroll down to read more.
Park Name: Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park

Alert: Closures: Detours; Towpath; Points of Interest
Description: Multiple items are closed due to hazardous conditions or maintenance. See below for more details.
