Alert: No Water Available Along Towpath
Description: Water faucets will remain off until mid-April. Please plan accordingly.
Park Name: Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park

Alert: High Water in Lehman Caves
Description: Visitors touring Lehman Caves are recommended to bring rain boots/rubber boots for the tour. Due to higher than normal snowpack that is starting to melt, several places along the tour route have standing water that is several inches deep.

Alert: Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive Closure @ Upper Lehman
Description: Due to ice and snow, the Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive is closed at Upper Lehman Creek Campground. Weather is highly variable in the park.

Alert: Potable water only at Lehman Caves Visitor Center
Description: Potable water is no longer available at campgrounds, picnic areas, the dump station, or bottle fill stations throughout the park. Potable water can only be found at a spigot on the North side of the Lehman Caves Visitor Center through the winter.

Alert: Potential for short delays on Volcano Road starting late April 2023
Description: Due to road repairs, there may be short, single lane safety closures and flaggers at any time Monday - Thursday. Full road closures are not anticipated. No closures or delays will occur Friday-Sunday.

Alert: Volcano Road Closed to RVs and Buses over 26 feet, and all Trailers.
Description: The Volcano Road is closed to RVs, buses, attached trailers or any other vehicles over 26 feet long due to the narrowness of the road and limited parking space at the volcano top. Trailer parking is available at the Visitor Center.

Alert: Volcano Road open with short single Lane section
Description: There is a 75-yard road segment of Volcano Road that will be one lane on a damaged section. We ask visitors to follow road signs and restrictions on the one lane section.

Alert: Federal Holiday Closure: Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Years Day
Description: For the Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Years Day Federal holidays, Capulin Volcano National Monument Visitor Center and Volcano Road will be closed November 24, December 25, and January 1. Volcano Road and all trails will be open for pedestrian traffic.

Alert: Credit/Debit Card Only to pay entrance fees
Description: Capulin Volcano only accepts credit/debit cards for entrance fees. Our cooperating association Park Store accepts cash, credit/debit cards, and checks. There are limited cash only entrance passes available through our cooperating association Park Store.

Alert: Don't Forget Your Credit or Debit Card! Amistad Visitor Center Is Cashless.
Description: As you pack for Spring Break, don't forget your credit/debit card to buy souvenirs and more. For your convenience, camping and lake use fees can be paid with your card at fee machines right in the campground where you find your site and near boat ramps.

Alert: Burn Ban for Val Verde County, Including Amistad National Recreation Area.
Description: Low humidity, warmer than normal temperatures, dry vegetation, and high winds have combined to create extreme fire conditions. The park is currently under a fire ban. All wood fires are prohibited. Liquid fuel camp stoves and charcoal grills are allowed.

Alert: Help Prevent Invasive Mussel Infestation
Description: A number of lakes, including some close to Amistad, are infested with aquatic invasive species that damage natural ecosystems and waterways. Boaters are advised to Clean, Drain, and Dry all boats and equipment every time. Click more to learn how to help.

Alert: Water Hazards Still Present
Description: Despite increasing water levels, underwater hazards are still present in the lake. Please be extra vigilant for potential damage to boat or other injury.

Alert: Road Closure at Amistad Acres
Description: Due to soil and vegetation damage caused by off-road vehicle travel near Amistad Acres, undesignated dirt loop roads in the area are closed to vehicle traffic until further notice. The area will remain open to foot traffic.

Alert: Thursday, April 6th, 2023
Description: The Home of Franklin D. Roosevelt and the Vanderbilt Mansion will be closed from 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM.

Alert: Thursday, April 6th, 2023
Description: The Home of Franklin D. Roosevelt and the Vanderbilt Mansion will be closed from 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM.
Park Name: Home Of Franklin D Roosevelt National Historic Site

Alert: Dogs Not allowed on ocean beaches in Jamaica Bay and Sandy Hook March 15- Sept. 15
Description: Dogs are not allowed on ocean beaches at Sandy Hook between March 15 through September 15. Dogs are not allowed on the ocean beaches at Jacob Riis Park, Fort Tilden, Breezy Point Tip and at the bayside of Breezy Point between March 15 through September 15

Alert: Dead Horse Bay Remains Closed to the Public
Description: The entire southern area of Dead Horse Bay, including Glass Bottle Beach, is closed to the public. Crews are working in these areas using heavy brush clearing equipment and performing radiation surveys.

Alert: Sandy Hook Lighthouse Closed Until Spring 2023
Description: The Sandy Hook Lighthouse will be closed to tours until Spring of 2023.

Alert: Jacob Riis Park Bays 3-5 closed to beach access
Description: Jacob Riis Park Bays 3-5:Closed to beach access due to unsafe conditions from severe erosion.

Alert: Picnic Area Parking Lot Closed
Description: The Picnic Area Road at George Washington Birthplace National Monument is closed for resurfacing. The Picnic Area remains open and can be accessed via the Nature Trail.

Alert: Visitor Center Closed Monday and Tuesday
Description: The Visitor Center at George Washington Birthplace National Monument is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. Park grounds are open daily 9:00 - 5:00 pm. On Mondays and Tuesdays, there are no tours of the Memorial House Museum.

Alert: Old Courthouse Closed for Renovations
Description: The Old Courthouse at Gateway Arch National Park is undergoing renovations as part of the $380-million CityArchRiver project, which is the largest public-private partnership in the history of the National Park Service. It is closed to all visitors.

Alert: Phone system is down
Description: Valles Caldera's phone system is currently down. For park information, please use vall_info@nps.gov or call 505-670-1612.

Alert: Backcountry vehicle route closed for the season
Description: The full backcountry vehicle route is closed for the winter season. Backcountry vehicle access is now limited to the Cabin District.

Alert: All natural and cultural resources are protected
Description: The removal of any artifact, antler, obsidian, and other mineral or plant material is strictly prohibited.

Alert: The Old Ingraham Highway Trail is closed for construction (not Main Park Road or walking trails)
Description: Old Ingraham Hwy trail (not SR 9336) will be closed south of the Hidden Lake turnoff from Jan. 9-May 31 for construction related to the Taylor Slough Flow Improvements Project, which will partially restore historic water flow patterns in Taylor Slough.

Alert: For entrance fees, we accept digital passes and credit/debit cards
Description: Digital passes or credit/debit cards are the ONLY method of payment at all fee collection areas. Pre-paid digital passes are available online and may be purchased in advance.

Alert: Road paving along Main Park Road - construction vehicles and altered traffic patterns
Description: Watch out for workers, construction vehicles, and changes to the traffic patterns. Locations along the main park road and in Flamingo have paving work occurring in upcoming weeks.

Alert: Gulf Coast area in Everglades City is open
Description: Restrooms, parking and the canoe/kayak launch are available. Boat tours and rental reservations can be made online. Wilderness permits can be reserved online and picked up from the Nathaniel P. Reed Visitor Center in Big Cypress National Preserve.

Alert: COVID-19
Description: Big Horn County's transmission rate for COVID-19 is now medium. Masks are no longer required in the museum or bookstore, but masks will be provided to those who do not have one and wish one.

Alert: Limited Public Access Until April 21
Description: Most park roads are closed to public vehicle travel and services are limited. Check the current roads status before traveling to the park.

Alert: Construction to Sidewalk
Description: 03/09/2023 Construction to the sidewalk in front of The Grange is ongoing. Access to the site is not affected, but please use caution when entering the site.

Alert: Hamilton Grange is open for limited hours
Description: Beginning 5/29/2022, access to Hamilton Grange National Memorial will be increased. Hours of operation are: Friday, Saturday, Sunday 10 am - 12 pm and 1 pm - 4 pm.

Alert: Elevator Unavailable
Description: Due to repairs, the Hamilton Grange National Memorial elevator will be unavailable until further notice. Please contact hagr_info@nps.gov with questions.

Alert: PRESCRIBED FIRE PLANNED FOR LAKE MEREDITH NATIONAL RECREATION AREA
Description: Fire managers plan to start prescribed burns beginning the week of March 6, 2023. Multiple prescribed burns are planned totaling approximately 2800 acres. Prescribed burning will occur at the North end of the park and expected to be completed by 5-31-23

Alert: Alibates Quarries Tours will be offered by appointment only during the off-season
Description: During the off-season, Alibates Quarries Tours will be offered by appointment only due to limited staff. Please call 806-857-6680 for reservations.

Alert: Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians
Description: Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.

Alert: Yockanookany Trail Section Closed to Equestrians
Description: The Yockanookany section of the Natchez Trace National Scenic Trail is closed to equestrian use effective immediately, due to safety concerns with trail bridges and boardwalks. The trail will remain open to pedestrians.

Alert: Partial Closure of Rocky Springs Trail
Description: The Rocky Springs section is closed from the Rocky Springs campground at milepost 55 to the northern terminus at milepost 59 until further notice. Visitors should observe posted closures. The trail is unsafe due to trail erosion and deteriorated bridges.

Alert: Hiking Advisory
Description: Due to high winds and rainfall from thunderstorms, damaged trees have fallen across many sections of the National Scenic Trail. Caution is advised on all trails. Be aware of your surroundings while hiking and look for overhead limbs that may pose a hazard

Alert: Hydrothermal Area Sidewalk Collapse
Description: A portion of the sidewalk at Sulphur Works hydrothermal area has collapsed. Stay clear of the marked area downslope of the road. Proceed across road at your own risk.

Alert: Lassen Volcanic Highway Closes to Through Traffic for Winter Season.
Description: The Lassen National Park Highway is closed for the winter/spring season. Access is limited to one mile from the northwest entrance to the Loomis Plaza and the southwest entrance to the Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center.

Alert: Oversnow Camping off-limits
Description: Oversnow camping is off-limits at the Southwest Campground due to present Dixie fire hazards. Self-contained camping is still allowed in the Southwest parking area, Fees apply, No tents.

Alert: Emergency Closures in Burned Areas
Description: Closures are in place for some facilities, infrastructure, and areas affected by the 2021 Dixie Fire. Please adhere to all closures indicated by CLOSED signs or described in emergency closure notices.

Alert: Be Aware of Burned Area Hazards
Description: Numerous hazards exist in areas affected by the 2021 Dixie Fire. Be prepared for falling/fallen trees or limbs, loose/falling rock, undefined/unmarked trails, and hidden stump holes. Click more to learn about burned area safety.

Alert: Mount Rainier National Park to move to cashless fee collection starting May 26
Description: Beginning May 26, Mount Rainier National Park will accept only electronic card payments for entrance fees and campgrounds. Electronic payment reduces transaction times, saves money, and improves accountability.

Alert: Grove of the Patriarchs closed to all public entry until further notice.
Description: Grove of the Patriarchs is closed to all public entry effective November 2021, and until further notice, due to significant damage from flooding.

Alert: Longmire to Paradise 2022-23 Winter Road Access Closure Mondays-Fridays
Description: The winter of 2022-23, public access to Paradise is limited to Saturdays and Sundays, weather/staff/equipment dependent. Due to staffing shortages the park does not have the capacity to maintain public access 7 day/week.

Alert: Check Twitter for updates on current conditions; roads/facilities may close due to adverse weather
Description: Roads and facilities in the park may close at any time. Always check MountRainierNPS on Twitter for updates before coming to the park (account not required to view though may need to refresh browser if prompted for a login.)

Alert: Masks optional in response to COVID-19 pandemic
Description: Due to a "LOW" COVID-19 Community Level, masks are optional for everyone in all Mount Rainier National Park buildings, regardless of vaccination status.

Alert: All vehicles are required to carry tire chains when traveling in the park.
Description: All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD vehicles, must carry tire chains in the park during the winter season (November 1 - May 1) and be prepared to use them when tire chain requirements are posted.

Alert: Avalanche Danger Exists Within Paradise Valley, Exit Glacier Canyon and Toe of Exit Glacier
Description: Avalanche Danger Exists Within Paradise Valley, Exit Glacier Canyon and Toe of Exit Glacier. Recent Avalanches Have Occurred. Travel Into These Areas Is Not Recommended Without Avalanche Training, Transceiver, Probe, and Shovel

Alert: Exit Glacier Developed Area open to Snowmachine use for winter 2022/23 season
Description: Kenai Fjords National Park opened the Exit Glacier Developed Area to off road snowmachine use on. Open areas include, the Exit Glacier Road, a designated route through the Exit Glacier campground to Exit Creek, and the Exit Glacier outwash plain.

Alert: Road to Exit Glacier closed to automobiles for the winter
Description: The road to Exit Glacier is now closed to automobile access at mile 1.3 of the Herman Leirer Road for the winter season.

Alert: Canyon from Toe of Exit Glacier to the Outwash Plain
Description: The canyon from the toe of Exit Glacier to where Exit Creek opens into the Outwash Plain is susceptible to sudden outburst flood events. These events produce sudden surges of water, ice and rock. The canyon is dangerous and travel is not recommended.

Alert: Abandoned Mines Hazard
Description: Abandoned mines exist on park lands. Explosives, mine openings, unsafe structures and toxic chemicals may be present. Visitors should use extreme caution and avoid abandoned mineral properties.

Alert: Toe of Exit Glacier, Ice Fall Hazard Zone
Description: An ice fall hazard zone has been identified at the toe and sides of Exit Glacier, due to tall blocks and slabs of ice. For your safety, entry into this zone is prohibited. Please do not continue past ice fall hazard signs and see photo for more details.

Alert: Visitor Center Hours Changing - March 12, 2023
Description: Beginning on Sunday, 12 March, the Henry Hill Visitor Center will be open from 8:30am - 5:00pm

Alert: COVID-19 Mask Requirement
Description: Masks are optional inside park buildings. We continue to monitor and respond to the COVID-19 pandemic and follow CDC guidance.

Alert: Caution: Red Tide effects have appeared in areas of the park
Description: Red Tide (Karenia brevis) effects have appeared in areas of the park. Visitors may experience strong odors, and respiratory irritations along coastal areas. Visitors with Asthma, COPD, or compromised respiratory systems should exercise caution.

Alert: Winter Closures
Description: The 'B' loop of the campground and the following caves are closed for the winter: Sentinel Cave, Sunshine Cave, Labyrinth Cave, Lava Brook Cave, Hercules Leg Cave, Juniper Cave, and the downstream portions of Thunderbolt Cave.

Alert: Winter Weather
Description: Due to snowfall and winter weather park roads, trails, walkways, cave entrances and parking areas may be icy and have snow covering them. Please travel carefully and watch your footing when hiking or caving.

Alert: White-Nose Syndrome / Cave Permit
Description: Please Do Not bring clothing or caving gear used in caves or mines outside of Lava Beds into our caves. This will help slow the spread of white-nose syndrome, a bat disease that is killing bats outside of the park.

Alert: Possible Downed Trees on Park Roads and Trails
Description: Due to recent heavy rainfall and high winds, there have been reports of several trails having trees fallen across impeding access. We advise all visitors to be cautious for downed trees and trees at risk of falling on roads and trails.
Park Name: New River Gorge National Park & Preserve

Alert: Phased Reopening and Outdoor Programming
Description: We are increasing access to the parks in phases. Beginning 1/15/2023, visitor centers at Cowpens and Kings Mountain will open 9 – 5 on Wed – Sun. Grounds & restrooms open daily 9 – 5.

Alert: High Wind Risk
Description: During the windy season (November through March, annually) the park often experiences high wind speeds (above 45MPH) and dangerous gusts (50MPH to above 80MPH). These strong winds can pose a risk to those hiking, camping, or driving.

Alert: Planning a Spring Break Visit?
Description: March is the busiest month in the park. Be prepared for parking areas and campgrounds to be at full capacity on weekends. Have a backup plan. Be flexible.

Alert: Williams Ranch Road Closed
Description: The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.

Alert: Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike
Description: The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks and may be unstable.

Alert: Thompson Memorial A.M.E. Zion Church Restoration
Description: The Thompson Memorial A.M.E. Zion Church and parsonage at 47 Parker Street, Auburn, are currently undergoing restoration and rehabilitation. The buildings are closed to the public, but are expected to open in late summer 2023.

Alert: Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway
Description: Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu(Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.

Alert: Haleakalā Visitor Center at 9,740 Feet Closed for a Building Improvement Project
Description: Haleakalā Visitor Center at 9,740 feet is temporarily closed for a building improvement project. The parking lot at this location remains open. Headquarters Visitor Center at 7,000 remains open from 8:30 am - 4:30 pm.

Alert: Wood lockers in cabins installed on November 1, 2018
Description: On November 1, 2018, a new wood locker system was implemented for cabin users. Each cabin houses 18 lockers, each stocked with three logs. Lockers assignments are issued through existing cabin reservations.

Alert: Avoid area around the church & under trees in high wind conditions
Description: In high wind conditions (sustained winds of 25 mph and above) visitors are advised to avoid the area around the church, with the possibility of falling clay tiles from the roof, and the cemetery, possibility of falling tree branches or limbs. Thank you.
Park Name: Saint Paul's Church National Historic Site

Alert: Belmont-Paul Women's Equality NM closed for renovations
Description: Renovation work funded through the Great American Outdoors Act (GAOA) began in January 2022. The museum will remain closed to the general public during construction. We hope to welcome visitors again in 2023.

Alert: Melrose Mansion Guided Tours
Description: Reservations for guided tours of the mansion must be made on Recreation.gov. Tours start at 9, 10, 11, 2, 3, and 4; masks are optional. Beginning March 1, Melrose will be temporarily closed on Tuesdays.

Alert: Face masks are now optional
Description: As Covid-related numbers have dipped below the CDC determined High Rate of Transmission in Adams County, Mississippi, face masks are no longer required in all NPS buildings at Natchez National Historical Park. Wearing of face masks is optional.

Alert: William Johnson House Remains Closed
Description: The William Johnson House remains closed at this time.

Alert: Giftshop closed the last Tuesday of every month
Description: The giftshop will be closed the last Tuesday of every month for inventory.

Alert: Tuskegee Airmen Hangar 1 and Hangar 2 Reopens
Description: The Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site has reopened Hangar 1 and Hangar 2 at a reduced capacity. Hours are Wednesday thru Saturday from 9 a.m. to 4:30 p.m cst. Site grounds are open 8 a.m. to sunset daily.

Alert: Wednesday, March 9, 2022: Changes to Masking Requirements Per CDC's Updated Guidance
Description: The Tuskegee Airmen NHS is in a county with a Low COVID-19 Community Level, so masks are currently not required in either indoor or outdoor locations.

Alert: Road Open To: Mile 13 (Mountain Vista)
Description: The Denali Park Road is open to Mile 13, Mountain Vista. Wintry conditions beyond that point prevent vehicle travel, though pedestrian travel is permitted. Be prepared for winter driving conditions to reach Mile 13.

Description: Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.

Description: Effective March 1st, the Museum Shop and Visitor Center will be mask-optional for all visitors and staff. However, masks will still be required on indoor building tours. Children under 5 can attend a neighborhood walking tour or visit us virtually

Park Name: Lower East Side Tenement Museum National Historic Site

Description: In accordance with current CDC guidance, masks are not required inside federal buildings if community transmission levels are low-medium. Masks are required when Coconino County levels are high.

Description: The Arizona Game and Fish Department and the Arizona Department of Agriculture have confirmed rabbit hemorrhagic disease virus (RHDV2) in Arizona cottontails and black-tailed jackrabbits. As always, please do not approach any wildlife during your visit.

Description: From Feb. 26 - May 13 the park will be in Spring Break Operations. Please be sure to plan for long lines, long waits and parking lots to be full. We ask the public to not park parallel, have passes and IDs ready, as well as exact change for entrance fee.

Alert: Park Closed to Buses, RVs and Trailers 10am - 2pm. Feb. 26 - May 13.

Alert: Masks are currently NOT REQUIRED when visiting Montezuma Castle National Monument
Description: Requirements are dependent upon Community Level and based on data provided by the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention (CDC) for counties where the park is located. Yavapai County is currently LOW and Masks are NOT REQUIRED inside Federal Buildings.

Alert: Annual Closure to Protect Nesting Peregrine Falcons
Description: To provide peregrine falcons adequate space for nesting, portions of Maryland Heights will be closed from Feb 15 to July 31, 2023. This includes several rock outcroppings near the overlook and certain climbing walls. The Maryland Heights Trail is OPEN.

Alert: Ongoing work on Lower Town buildings
Description: Facilities staff are doing repair work on several buildings in Lower Town. Please follow signs for alternate entrances and heed temporary closures.

Description: The French Quarter and New Orleans Jazz NHP Visitor Center is temporarily moved to 916 N. Peters Street, New Orleans, LA 70116. For more details and updates, click "more" below.

Description: Beginning Sunday, Jan. 15, 2023, the visitor center at Ninety Six will be open daily Wednesday to Sunday from 9:00 am to 4:30 pm. Restrooms and park grounds are open 7 days per week, except on federal holidays specified in the superintendent’s compendium.

Alert: Mask Status in Park Buildings – MASKS OPTIONAL - starting September 9
Description: Consistent with CDC guidance, face coverings are not required in federal buildings at Low or Medium COVID rates. During High COVID rates masks will be required.

Description: Fishermen's Trail is closed for trail and bridge maintenance. For more information about Ninety Six National Historic Site's available trails, please call the park at 864-543-4068.

Description: Main St. will close Sunday, March 12th from about 11am till about 3:00pm for the annual West Orange St. Patrick's Day Parade. Until Main St. reopens, our parking lots will be closed. Parking may be available on Lakeside Ave or nearby streets.

Alert: Masking at Thomas Edison NHP
Description: Masks are required in buildings when the CDC has marked the COVID-19 Community Level HIGH for Essex County. On the site, enter New Jersey as the state and Essex as the county. Guidance updates every week by Friday. Check the Site here for current level:

Alert: Gallatin House Wheelchair Ramp Construction
Description: The wheelchair ramp into the Gallatin House will be under construction from February 27th to April 30th, 2023. This will prevent wheelchair access to the historic home and may impede accessibility for other visitors until the work is completed.

Alert: Gallatin House Winter Hours
Description: The Gallatin Houses is open Saturdays and Sundays only, 9 a.m. - 5 p.m. October through April. Park grounds and trails remain open daily from sunrise to sunset.

Alert: Slippery Conditions along Mainland Trail and Meyers Beach Parking Area
Description: Freezing temperatures, following recent rains, glazed the trail and parking area at Meyers Beach with a layer of ice. Shoe traction devices and trekking poles are highly recommended. Use extra caution where the trail approaches the cliff edge.

Alert: Winter Fee Collection
Description: Winter Meyers Beach parking fees will only be collected with the Recreation.gov app Scan&Pay feature. Download the Recreation.gov app before visiting to pay fees when out of cell service. Cash fee envelopes may not be available.

Alert: Ongoing Storm Damage Closures
Description: Ongoing list of closures related to previous storm damage for public safety: Devils Island Dock & Campsite; West Bay Club on Sand Island; Hokenson Dock at Little Sand Bay.

Alert: Private Property: Sand & Rocky Islands
Description: Reminder: There are private holdings on the southeast corner of Sand Island, and just north of Group Site A on Rocky Island. It is trespassing to be on their property, including their docks. Stay out of those clearly marked areas or you can be fined.

Alert: Park Closed to the Public
Description: The park is currently closed to the public. If you would like learn more about Honouliuli when visiting O‘ahu, you can visit our partner at the Japanese Cultural Center of Hawai‘i in Honolulu.

Alert: Visitor Center Relocated
Description: Due to an ongoing renovation project, the main Visitor Center will be closed. Services such as the museum and movie will be unavailable at this time. Other services such as public restrooms and park information have been moved to the temporary VC.

Alert: COVID-19 Mask Requirement
Description: Consistent with CDC guidance regarding areas of substantial or high transmission, visitors to Russell Cave National Monument, regardless of vaccination status, are required to wear a mask inside all park buildings.

Alert: Visitor Center Closed for Season
Description: Brochures & park stamps are available daily at Fort Moultrie on Sullivan's Island. The outdoor grounds & restrooms are open Wednesday through Sunday. The site is fully closed Monday & Tuesday. Please monitor this website for our spring 2023 re-opening

Alert: Roofing Project Underway
Description: Beginning February 6, 2023, construction crews are working on the roof of the historic home. Please avoid marked construction areas and blocked walkways. The project will last about 6 weeks.

Alert: Whitewater Creek Access Road and Parking Lot Closed
Description: The Whitewater Creek access road and parking lot are closed for storm damage assessment and repairs. Trails at East Palisades remain open, but please visit alternate park units.

Alert: Temporary Closure of Trail in Bowmans Island Unit
Description: The trail between markers BI 3 & BI 20 will be closed due to construction on foot bridges. Trail connectivity will be available through the local connector between markers BI 15 & BI 25. This closure will begin October 24 and last until further notice.

Alert: Johnson Ferry North Trail Closure
Description: The Colonial Pipeline Company will begin work in the Johnson Ferry North unit on October 17,2022. Construction activities will close the utility road and one section of the river trail. All other trails will remain open. Directional signs will be posted.

Alert: Face Masks Optional
Description: The NPS face mask guidance is based on the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Face masks are currently optional at Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area, however you are welcome to wear a mask if it makes you more comfortable.

Alert: Riparian Trail is currently closed
Description: Due to safety issues, the Riparian trail is currently closed to the public. This trail is located half way up the Mount Wanda Fire road, past the Nature Trail. Please do not access this trail until further notice.

Alert: Mask Policy - December 30, 2022
Description: Masks are required inside all park shuttles and vehicles.

Alert: Martinez Adobe
Description: The Martinez Adobe, located on the western edge of John Muir’s historic orchard, is currently closed due to structural damage. It is unknown when the public will be able to enter the structure. The Muir/Strentzel mansion remains open to visitors.

Alert: Nature Center Closed on Wednesdays this Spring
Description: To plan for new activities and onboard new staff, starting February 15, the Rock Creek Park Nature Center and Planetarium will be closed to the public on Wednesdays, continuing into late spring. We will remain open Thursday through Sunday, 9am to 5pm.

Alert: Restrooms at Picnic Grove #10 temporarily closed
Description: The restroom facility at Picnic Grove #10 along Beach Drive is temporarily closed. Restroom facilities are open at Picnic Grove #1, Picnic Grove #6, Picnic Grove #24, behind Peirce Barn, and at the Rock Creek Nature Center during business hours.

Alert: Glover-Archbold trail detour
Description: For visitor safety, the southern end of the Glover-Archbold Trail is under an emergency closure until further notice due to aerial hazards. Please follow the posted detour along Foxhall Rd. / 44th St. NW / P St. NW.

Alert: Bingham Drive NW closed temporarily
Description: Until further notice, Bingham Drive NW is closed between Oregon Avenue NW and Beach Drive NW due to a sewer rehabilitation project. The adjacent paved trail will remain open during construction for pedestrians and cyclists.

Alert: Wind Cave moves to cashless fee collection
Description: Payments for cave tours, campground fees, as well as Interagency Passes at Wind Cave National Park, will be by credit/ debit cards or digital payments only. Cash and check payments will no longer be accepted.

Alert: NPS Roads 5 & 6 not maintained in winter
Description: NPS Roads 5 & 6 are open but not maintained in winter and may be impassable at times.

Alert: Park Museum Opening
Description: The museum at Klondike Gold Ruah National Historical Park will be open to visitors starting February 27. It will be open. 10-4 Monday-Friday until April 30, when it will go to expanded hours.
Park Name: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park

Alert: Chilkoot Trail Remains Closed Due to Extensive Flood Damage
Description: The Chilkoot Trail remains closed to the public as a result of recent flooding events. Repair work to open the trail will be extensive.
Park Name: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park

Alert: Carter G. Woodson Home NHS temporarily closed.
Description: Carter G. Woodson Home National Historic Site is temporarily closed due to a full renovation project. The anticipated reopening is scheduled for late Fall 2023. Please continue to visit the website for future updates.
Park Name: Carter G. Woodson Home National Historic Site

Alert: Be Aware of Illegal Traffic
Description: Smuggling and/or illegal entry is common in this area due to the proximity of the international border. Please be aware of your surroundings at all times and do not travel alone in remote areas.

Alert: Montezuma Canyon Road to Montezuma Pass
Description: The two miles of dirt road beyond the visitor center and up to Montezuma Pass is extremely rough. Currently vehicles without high clearance should not attempt the drive. Four-wheel drive is also recommended when the road is wet.

Alert: COVID-19 Masking Advisory
Description: The park continues to monitor the CDC's community level for COVID-19. When that level is at HIGH, masks will be required in the visitor center.

Alert: Summit Road Winter Status
Description: Due to dangerous conditions caused by snow and ice, the Summit Road is often closed during the winter season. For the latest on the status of the road, please contact the visitor center at 308-436-9700.

Alert: No Summit Shuttle
Description: Due to mechanical issues, the Summit Shuttle is not currently available.

Alert: The Oaks, Home of Booker T. Washington is currently closed
Description: The Oaks, Home of Booker T. Washington is currently closed as it undergoes rehabilitation work. The grounds are open from sunup to sundown daily.

Alert: The George Washington Carver Museum open Thursday and Friday
Description: The George Washington Carver Museum will undergo rehabilitation work beginning in 2023. The museum is currently open to visitors Thursday and Friday from 9:00-4:30cst.

Alert: Echo and Hole in the Wall now open- Roadside camping permit required
Description: A free permit is now required to camp along these roads. No permit is required for day use. Click below for more information.

Alert: Winter Closures
Description: The access road to Telescope Peak trailhead is closed beyond the Charcoal Kilns, due to snowy conditions. Many other roads remain closed due to damage and debris from major flooding this summer. Click 'more' for a map and detailed information.

Alert: Frederick Douglass NHS is Closed
Description: Beginning March 1, 2022, the Frederick Douglass NHS is closed to the public for renovations until late Spring 2023. For future announcements and virtual programming, please visit the webpage and follow the park on social media.

Alert: Mask Mandate
Description: In areas of substantial or high community transmission, agencies must require all Federal employees, onsite contractors, and visitors, regardless of vaccination status, to wear a mask inside of Federal buildings.

Alert: Delassus-Kern House and Property Closed
Description: Due to hazardous conditions, the Delassus-Kern House and surrounding property are closed indefinitely.

Alert: Bauvais-Amoureux House Closed
Description: The Bauvais-Amoureux House is currently closed for a roofing project.

Alert: Park contact stations (visitor centers and ranger stations) closed in winter
Description: The park's public lands are always open but visitor facilities have limited seasons: Closed in winter between October and April. Call (907) 822-5234 or email wrst_info@nps.gov for park information.
Park Name: Wrangell - St Elias National Park & Preserve

Alert: Masks are Optional in Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts Facilities
Description: Consistent with CDC guidance regarding COVID-19 Community Levels (Fairfax County is currently low), the wearing of masks in Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts grounds and facilities is optional.
Park Name: Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts

Alert: Lot 3 and Sidewalk Area Closure
Description: Due to ongoing construction projects, parking Lot 3 and upper sidewalk area leading from Ovations Pavilion to Filene Center Dinner Gate will be closed to the public until further notice.
Park Name: Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts

Alert: Winter 2023 Operating Hours for Visitor Center and Museum
Description: The Visitor Center and Museum is open 5-days (Wednesday-Sunday). Operating hours are 9:00 am to 5:00 pm. The grounds (including all trails) at Camp Nelson National Monument are open 7-days a week, sunrise to sunset.

Alert: COVID-19 Update: Masks Optional
Description: The park is open, including the visitor center, trails, waterways, and day-use areas. Masks are optional. See COVID-19 status page for more info.

Alert: Turkey Creek Bridge Closed
Description: The iron bridge over Turkey Creek between the Kirby and Sandhill Loop trails is closed for repairs. Kirby and Sandhill are open but not connected at this time. The Turkey Creek Trail is open between FM 1943 and Sandhill Loop.

Alert: Road work throughout park in summer 2023
Description: Road work will be occurring throughout the park during the 2023 summer season. Please check back for additional information as it becomes available.

Alert: The Point Campground to close for road work Sept. 5, 2023 to Nov. 30, 2023
Description: The Point Campground will close for road work on September 5, 2023. Work is expected to take until the end of November. If work is completed early, the campground will reopen at that time.

Alert: Antietam Battlefield Visitor Center Partially Closed
Description: The park is operating out of a temporary visitor center while the permanent one undergoes rehabilitation. We expect to complete the project Summer 2023. Restrooms, exhibits and the park store are open daily from 9a -5p.

Alert: Trail Damage
Description: Due to recent widespread rain and flood conditions, please be aware that some trails have been heavily damaged and are not accessible. Exercise caution and plan ahead!
Park Name: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area

Alert: Construction alert for Cheeseboro Canyon
Description: A trailhead improvement project (Sept. 19, 2022 - early summer 2023) will close the entire area around the regular Cheeseboro parking lot. A temporary parking lot is available off Chesebro Road. Access to trails will continue. Heed all signs!
Park Name: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area

Alert: Darrah Hall Rehabilitation Project
Description: In 2023, the park will be engaged in rehabilitation work at Darrah Hall. We plan to keep the facility open for its regular hours of operation, but visitors should be aware of potential construction work around the site.

Alert: Current Masking Requirements
Description: If the CDC COVID-19 Community Level for Beaufort County, SC is "High", masks will be required in all park buildings. Please visit the CDC website for current Community Levels

Alert: Building Closures - Historic Preservation
Description: There are a few projects underway. From time to time this may require that we close certain areas or structures for the protection of our staff, visitors, and park resources. We appreciate your understanding while we perform this critical work.

Alert: Winter Hours
Description: Hopewell Furnace roads, visitor center and historic village are open Wednesday through Sunday from 9:00am to 5:00pm and closed Monday and Tuesday from October 17, 2022 until Memorial Day Monday May 29, 2023.

Alert: Current Visiting Requirements
Description: Tours of the Roosevelt Home are offered Thursday-Sunday and are by advanced reservation only. Masks are not required, but you may choose to wear one. Old Orchard Museum is open Thursday-Sunday from 11:00am-4:00pm. Grounds open daily sunrise-sunset.

Alert: Sagamore Hill is Cashless
Description: Cash payments at Sagamore Hill are no longer be accepted as a method of payment for National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Passes. Credit and Debit Cards are accepted.

Alert: Raptor Nest Climbing Closures in Effect
Description: Beginning January 17th 2023, many climbing routes (especially in the Balconies area) are under a closure. Read more about it here. https://www.nps.gov/pinn/planyourvisit/advisory.htm

Alert: Storm Hazards on Roads and Trails
Description: Flooding on roads and on trails, especially at stream crossings and in enclosed canyons and caves, can be unexpectedly strong. Rocks and trees may fall over roads and trails as well. Hazards may persist long after the storm subsides.

Alert: High Crowds & Park Capacity

Alert: The Visitor Center at Fort Clatsop is under remodel starting Jan. 16.

Alert: Change in Park Hours
Description: Beginning Sunday, January 22, we will implement a seasonal schedule. During winter hours (November 1-March 31), the gates open from 7 am to 7 pm. Summer hours (April 1-October 31) are 7 am to 9 pm. Vehicles remaining in park after closing will be towed.

Alert: Pacific Arch closed through February 23
Description: The Pacific Arch will be closed for maintenance through Feb 23. During this time, pedestrian access to the memorial is through the Atlantic Arch or ceremonial entrance on 17th Street. The accessible entrance is via the Atlantic Arch.

Alert: No Fireworks for Independence Day

Alert: No Cell Service or WiFi
Description: We do not recommend taking a rideshare or taxi to Muir Woods. There is NO cell service or wifi at Muir Woods. When hiring a taxi visitors have the option of negotiating a flat rate, or using the meter. Under some circumstances a flat rate may be cheaper.

Alert: COVID-19 Masking Guidance
Description: The park continues to monitor the CDC's community level for COVID-19. When that level is at HIGH, masks will be required in the visitor center.

Alert: Butterfield Trail Closure
Description: The Butterfield Trail is currently closed to horses and pack animals. It remains open for hiking and foot traffic. For more information, see our policy page.

Alert: Do Not Feed or Touch Wildlife
Description: Wildlife accustomed to being fed will become aggressive to obtain food. This includes coyote and fox. There have been serious incidents involving bites to people and pets. Report injured or deceased wildlife to park staff. Never touch injured wildlife.

Alert: Stay Back from Ocean Bluffs
Description: Remain off tops of bluffs and away from the bases of bluffs on the beach. Bluffs along the Outer Cape are unstable and could collapse at any time without warning.

Alert: Backcountry and Trail Closures Due to Flood Damage
Description: The backcountry & the following trails are closed: Slaughter & Yucca Canyon & access roads, Guadalupe Ridge (visitor center to west park boundary), Rattlesnake Canyon, Juniper Ridge, Ussery, & Double Canyon. Cavern trails & the Old Guano Trail are open.

Alert: Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage
Description: Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown at this time when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open.

Alert: Reservations Required to Enter Carlsbad Cavern
Description: RESERVATIONS REQUIRED to enter cavern and must be purchased by clicking "more" or calling 877-444-6777. No reservations available at the park. Reservations only select the entry time. Upon arrival at the visitor center, entrance tickets must be purchased.

Alert: COVID-19: Face Masks Optional
Description: Consistent with CDC community level guidance, face masks are currently optional for visitors to Carlsbad Caverns National Park inside all park buildings and the cavern. Please check this site before visiting due to possible community level changes.

Alert: Items Worn or Used in Other Caves Not Allowed
Description: A disease know as White-Nose Syndrome is killing bats in North America. To prevent it from spreading to our bats, do not wear shoes, clothing, or bring any gear into any cave at Carlsbad Caverns National Park that were in another cave.

Alert: Footwear in the Cavern
Description: For safety, closed-toe shoes with good traction are recommended. Flip flops, sandals, and some walking shoes have little or no traction and increase the possibility of slips, trips, and falls. Watch your step and use the handrails when necessary.

Alert: Unmanned Aircraft (Drones) Are Prohibited
Description: The use of unmanned aircraft, also known as drones, is prohibited within Carlsbad Caverns National Park.

Alert: Kenilworth Park Road Repairs and Turf Restoration
Description: Over the next 4 months, road repairs will be made to the Deane Ave. extension through Kenilworth Park. The park will install temporary fencing, and regrading and re-seeding of the adjacent turf areas will be accomplished. Re-seeding will occur Spring 2023

Alert: January 2023 - April 2023
Description: The Eleanor Roosevelt NHS (Val-Kill) will close for the Winter. The grounds will remain open every day. We will re-open in the Spring of 2023, date TBD.

Alert: Credit Card Only

Alert: COVID-19 Mask Requirement - Currently Optional
